title: Entry Level Data Analyst - Remote | WFH
description: Are you a recent graduate in Computer Science, Engineering, Mathematics, Statistics, or a related field, eager to kick-start your career in the IT industry? Look no further! We are a leading tech company dedicated to empowering job seekers like you and helping you build successful careers. Join us and unlock a world of opportunities!<br><br><strong><u>Why Choose Us<br><br></u></strong>Career Development: We go beyond merely securing you a job; we build careers. Our proven track record since 2010 speaks for itself, with thousands of candidates successfully placed at renowned technology companies such as Apple, Google, Paypal, Western Union, Visa, Walmart Labs, and more.<br><br>Inclusive Hiring: All positions are open to candidates of all visas and US citizens. We understand the challenges of finding the perfect match between employer requirements and employee skills, and we are here to bridge that gap.<br><br>Skill Enhancement Programs: We offer comprehensive skill enhancement programs designed to bolster your skills and industry/client experience. Whether you're lacking certain skills, struggling to crack interviews, or aiming to enhance your skill portfolio, we have you covered.<br><br>Visa Support: We provide assistance with filing for STEM extensions, H1B visas, and Green Cards, ensuring a seamless transition for qualified candidates.<br><br><strong><u>Who Should Apply<br><br></u></strong>We enthusiastically welcome recent graduates in Computer Science, Engineering, Mathematics, Statistics, or related fields who are passionate about pursuing a rewarding career in the IT industry. Candidates of all visas and US citizens are encouraged to apply.<br><br>Candidates can benefit from our skill enhancement programs if they fall into the following categories:<br><br>Lack Experience: Freshers or those with no actual job experience, we offer hands-on projects with clients to provide real-world exposure.<br><br>Career Break: Candidates who have taken a break in their careers can regain their momentum by acquiring industry/client experience and skills through our programs.<br><br>Technical Competency: If you lack specific technical skills that are in high demand, our skill enhancement programs will equip you with the necessary expertise.<br><br>Different Visa Holders: Candidates on OPT, H4EAD, L2EAD visas seeking employment opportunities and a stable career in the USA can rely on our support.<br><br><strong><u>Join Our Successful Candidates<br><br></u></strong>Discover the success stories of our candidates on our website at [insert link to candidate outcomes page]. Watch our team in action at industry events, including Oracle Cloud World and Gartner Data Analytics Summit, on our YouTube channel at [insert YouTube channel link].<br><br><strong><u>How To Apply<br><br></u></strong>If you possess the required skills and industry experience, don't hesitate to submit your application. However, if you feel the need for skill enhancement, we encourage you to explore our programs. For assistance with interviews, we have a dedicated section on our website offering helpful resources and interview questions at [insert link].<br><br><strong><u>Job Requirements<br><br></u></strong>Java / Software Programmers:<br><br>Bachelor's or Master's degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, Electrical Engineering, Information Systems, or IT.<br><br>Highly motivated, self-learner, and technically inquisitive.<br><br>Proficiency in Java and understanding of the software development life cycle.<br><br>Project work and experience in Core Java, JavaScript, C++, or software programming.<br><br>Familiarity with Spring Boot, Microservices, Docker, Jenkins, and REST APIs.<br><br>Excellent written and verbal communication skills.<br><br><strong><u>Data Science / Machine Learning<br><br></u></strong>Bachelor's or Master's degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, Electrical Engineering, Information Systems, or IT.<br><br><strong><u>Project Work And Experience In The Required Technologies.<br><br></u></strong>Highly motivated, self-learner, and technically inquisitive.<br><br>Proficiency in Java and understanding of the software development life cycle.<br><br>Knowledge of Statistics, SAS, Python, Computer Vision, and data visualization tools.<br><br>Excellent written and verbal communication skills.<br><br>Preferred skills: NLP, Text Mining, Tableau, Power BI, Time Series Analysis.<br><br>Please note that even for junior or entry-level positions, clients require skills and relevant experience on real-world projects. Additional skills and hands-on experience are vital for candidate selection. If you lack certain skills or project work, we encourage you to consider our skill enhancement programs. We do not accept third-party or c2c candidates.<br><br>Apply now to embark on an exciting career journey with us!<br><br>Employment Type: Full-Time<br><br>Salary: $ 100,000.00 160,000.00 Per Year

title: Data Analyst
description: We are searching for a data engineer I with python experience who learns quickly and thrives in a fast-paced, innovative environment. The role is to help empower a global technology focused Product Validation team to reliably collect data and deliver product performance insights in the customer use case through the creative use of data. Part of the role also involves helping us build a powerful data platform to provide real data driven value to the Precision Technology group. You will design, develop, and evaluate infrastructure, data processors, and persistence from concept through production stage, and make modifications as needed. The DataOps team is currently fully remote, located in North America, and we are looking to expand our team into Europe to better support the regional Product Validation testing team. Work with teams generating and consuming data to understand the purpose, application, valid states, and interoperability of data needs. Responsible to build and maintain trust with a low error rate by developing data tests that can isolate unhealthy data for accurate analysis and reporting Develop and monitor data pipeline performance, data integrity and usage metrics Identify needs and develop infrastructure to satisfy the data pipeline for consuming data that retains target uptime. Develop data processors to validate data entering the pipeline before it's consumed by end users. May maintain and extend Data Governance and Data catalogs as appropriate. Develop and extend tools to aid in the discovery and reporting of data for system and end user insight. May generate transformed data exports to support other teams. Aid in tracking data utilization to shape enhancements to the Data Catalog. Keep abreast of new developments in the domains of cloud computing and data science. May be called upon to perform comparable duties of a similar or related nature and/or assist in other areas as needed.<br><br>Minimum of a Bachelor's degree in Engineering, in field related to specific position.<br><br>Refer to Engineer Level Guide (below) for placement in level: 1- Engineer, 2 Senior Engineer, 3 Staff Engineer, 4 Principal Engineer.<br><br>Engineering field applicable to this position: Software.<br><br>Experience with Cloud Computing (Amazon Web Services or Microsoft Azure).<br><br>Proficiency in Automation, Provisioning, and Orchestration tools (Gitlab Pipelines, Terraform, Ansible, DataKitchen, etc.<br><br>Understanding of ETL pipelines, streaming services, and storage/access patterns<br><br>Understanding the development, persistence, and application of Machine Learning datasets is beneficial. Experience writing software to develop efficient pipeline processors; ideally in Python.<br><br>Big Data specialty certifications are beneficial.<br><br>Specific skills, proficiencies, and knowledge in field related to position, as identified by department leadership.<br><br>Ability to apply design theory and methodology.<br><br>Well-developed problem analysis and problem-solving techniques.<br><br>Proficiency with a computer, including use of Microsoft Word and Excel.<br><br>Team player who is self-motivated and has ability to work with minimal supervision. Ability to communicate effectively with team members and leadership staff across a wide variety of specialties.

title: Technical/Data Analyst - Remote | WFH
description: Join our dynamic team as a key contributor in the core delivery department, working on exciting client programs focused on demand response and energy efficiency. As part of our passionate and collaborative team, you'll have the opportunity to closely collaborate with both business and technical stakeholders to drive impactful outcomes. Initially, this role will be remote, with a future return to our vibrant office located in Oak Brook, Il when it reopens. Reporting to our dedicated senior leader overseeing this client engagement, you'll play a vital role in shaping our success.<br><br><strong><u>Responsibilities<br><br></u></strong>Support and nurture relationships with clients, vendors, partners, and other third parties to ensure the seamless execution of utility programs.<br><br>Collect and analyze data, including comprehensive testing and validation, to facilitate program operations, reporting, and evaluation.<br><br>Develop and maintain an in-depth understanding of various programs, including intricate details of reporting at the file and field level, enabling you to troubleshoot effectively.<br><br>Create, review, maintain, and present program information and documentation to diverse audiences, including our valued clients' customers.<br><br>Take ownership of data collection, data exchange processes, manipulation, and organization, demonstrating a strong sense of accountability.<br><br>Collaborate with developers and technical experts to design, update, and troubleshoot the underlying technical processes supporting utility programs.<br><br><strong><u>Required Qualifications<br><br></u></strong>Exposure to utilities, energy data, or the broader energy market in the US, or relevant educational background.<br><br>Proven experience in client-facing roles, with a track record of building and managing strong relationships.<br><br>Familiarity with technology and data, and the ability to dive deep into the details to solve complex business problems.<br><br>Comfort working independently, taking initiative to define and manage tasks, and embracing new responsibilities, challenges, or problems with enthusiasm.<br><br>A strong desire to learn and grow professionally, with the potential for significant career advancement from this role.<br><br><strong><u>Desired Qualifications<br><br></u></strong>Background in technology, including familiarity with software or middleware application development, infrastructure, testing, technical support, and/or maintenance.<br><br>Exposure to SQL and the MSFT tech stack, complemented by a solid understanding of database structures and interactions.<br><br>Experience generating reports tailored to business requirements for various purposes.<br><br>Previous exposure to client or project budget management.<br><br>Knowledge of regression analysis or other data evaluation methods.<br><br><strong><u>Benefits<br><br></u></strong>At our company, we value our employees and offer a competitive compensation package. As part of our team, you'll enjoy:<br><br>Competitive compensation and potential for bonuses.<br><br>Employee equity to foster a sense of ownership.<br><br>Comprehensive insurance plans with 100% coverage for employees and 50% coverage for dependents.<br><br>A robust 401k plan.<br><br>Paid holidays and an unlimited paid time off policy, promoting work-life balance.<br><br>Join us today to embark on an exciting journey with ample opportunities for personal growth and career advancement.<br><br>Employment Type: Full-Time<br><br>Salary: $ 49,000.00 115,000.00 Per Year

title: Data Governance Analyst
description: We’re building a relationship-oriented bank for the modern world. We need talented, passionate professionals who are dedicated to doing what’s right for our clients.<p><br></p>At CIBC, we embrace your strengths and your ambitions, so you are empowered at work. Our team members have what they need to make a meaningful impact and are truly valued for who they are and what they contribute.<p><br></p>To learn more about CIBC, please visit CIBC.com<p><br></p><strong>Job Description</strong><p><br></p>The Data Governance Analyst supports ongoing critical data identification and definition activities. The incumbent will be responsible for two critical functions: 1) use independent judgement to identify, anticipate and oversee identification of data that is critical to strategic business objectives and 2) execution of data policy and standard requirements for identified critical data elements in partnership with lines of business and functional groups. The ideal candidate will bring a variety of skills, be proactive in solving problems, be able to work independently and part of a team, and be comfortable communicating with many different levels of employees across the organization.<p><br></p><strong>Business Unit Description</strong><p><br></p>The US Data Management Office is responsible for establishing data as a strategic asset for CIBC US Region, further enhancing data governance, building out our data and analytic capabilities, and developing the US Region data management strategy.<p><br></p>Our strategy: Leverage data and analytics to build competitive advantage to enhance our client focus. To facilitate this, we will:<p><br></p><ul><li>Improve our data quality through focused data governance programs and processes</li><li>Use new data technology to increase agility and reduce cost</li><li>Become an analytics leader, focusing on continuous advancement</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Position Responsibilities</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Analyze reporting outputs to trace metrics back to underlying data components and sources to facilitate critical data identification and classification discussions with business Subject Matter Experts</li><li>Coordinate with stakeholders across the business and technology to define critical data including business, technical and operational metadata attributes</li><li>Monitoring, measuring and taking action to address data quality within the US Data Catalog by incorporating and understanding information from a variety of sources to recommend a course of action</li><li>Escalating, managing and reporting critical data identification and definition issues with transparency, as well as effectively creating accountability with those who fail to maintain these standards</li><li>Be informed and engaged as a subject matter expert on data-related regulatory requirements, organizational policies and standards, as well as industry best practices</li><li>Provide appropriate guidance, education, training, and communication to all relevant stakeholders</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Qualifications</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>5 years of related work experience in Data Governance</li><li>Broad and comprehensive knowledge and understanding of banking operations and data governance concepts (DCAM preferred) </li><li>Disciplined self-starter with strong analytical, logical, reasoning and problem-solving skills</li><li>Ability to prioritize and handle multiple tasks in a fast-paced environment with attention to detail and accuracy</li><li>Confidence to work directly with all levels of management and facilitate meetings</li><li>Excellent communication skills - both verbally and written</li><li>Proficiency in Microsoft Office Suite (Excel, PowerPoint and Word) and SharePoint</li><li>Ability to work flexibly in a team environment</li></ul><p><br></p>California residents — your privacy rights regarding your actual or prospective employment<p><br></p><strong>What You Need To Know</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>CIBC is committed to creating an inclusive environment where all team members and clients feel like they belong. We seek applicants with a wide range of abilities and we provide an accessible candidate experience. If you need accommodation, please contact Mailbox.careers-carrieres@cibc.com</li><li>You need to be legally eligible to work at the location(s) specified above and, where applicable, must have a valid work or study permit.</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Job Location</strong><p><br></p>IL-70 W Madison St, 8th Fl<p><br></p><strong>Employment Type</strong><p><br></p>Regular<p><br></p><strong>Weekly Hours</strong><p><br></p>40<p><br></p><strong>Skills</strong><p><br></p>Data Analysis, Data Governance, Data Management, Facilitation, Microsoft Power BI, Prioritization, Problem Solving, Project Management, Working Independently

title: Data Scientist / Data Analyst - Remote | WFH
description: We have partnered with a large Healthcare provider the Chicago, IL area to provide them with a Data Engineer.<br><br>Please review the below description and if you are interested please contact:<br><ul><li>Rhondolyn Kilgore at rkilgore@relevante.com<br></li></ul>Responsible for expanding and optimizing our data and data pipeline architecture, as well as optimizing data flow and collection for cross functional teams. The ideal candidate is an experienced data pipeline builder and data wrangler who enjoys optimizing data systems and building them from the ground up. The right candidate will be excited by the prospect of optimizing or even re-designing our company’s data architecture to support our next generation of products and data initiatives.<br><br><strong><u>Responsibilities Of The Data Engineer<br></u></strong><ul><li>Create and maintain optimal data pipeline architecture,</li><li>Assemble large, complex data sets that meet functional / non-functional business requirements.</li><li>Identify, design, and implement internal process improvements: automating manual processes, optimizing data delivery, re-designing infrastructure for greater scalability, etc.</li><li>Build the infrastructure required for optimal extraction, transformation, and loading of data from a wide variety of data sources using SQL and AWS ‘big data’ technologies.</li><li>Build analytics tools that utilize the data pipeline to provide actionable insights into customer acquisition, operational efficiency and other key business performance metrics.</li><li>Work with stakeholders including the Executive, Product, Data and Design teams to assist with data-related technical issues and support their data infrastructure needs.</li><li>Keep our data separated and secure across national boundaries through multiple data centers and AWS regions.</li><li>Create data tools for analytics and data scientist team members that assist them in building and optimizing our product into an innovative industry leader</li><li>Work with data and analytics experts to strive for greater functionality in our data systems.<br></li></ul><strong><u>Requirements Of The Data Engineer<br></u></strong><ul><li>Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Statistics, Informatics, Information Systems or another quantitative field (Masters Preferred).</li><li>5+ years of experience in a Data Engineer role</li><li>Advanced working SQL knowledge and experience working with relational databases, query authoring (SQL) as well as working familiarity with a variety of databases.</li><li>Experience building and optimizing ‘big data’ data pipelines, architectures and data sets.</li><li>Experience performing root cause analysis on internal and external data and processes to answer specific business questions and identify opportunities for improvement.</li><li>Strong analytic skills related to working with unstructured datasets.</li><li>Build processes supporting data transformation, data structures, metadata, dependency and workload management.</li><li>A successful history of manipulating, processing and extracting value from large disconnected datasets.</li><li>Working knowledge of message queuing, stream processing, and highly scalable ‘big data’ data stores.</li><li>Experience supporting and working with cross-functional teams in a dynamic environment.</li><li>Experience with health care datasets, clinical data, payer/claims data, SDOH data, etc.</li><li>Experience with big data tools: Hadoop, Spark, description_json: We have partnered with a large Healthcare provider the Chicago, IL area to provide them with a Data Engineer.<br><br>Please review the below description and if you are interested please contact:<br><ul><li>Rhondolyn Kilgore at rkilgore@relevante.com<br></li></ul>Responsible for expanding and optimizing our data and data pipeline architecture, as well as optimizing data flow and collection for cross functional teams. The ideal candidate is an experienced data pipeline builder and data wrangler who enjoys optimizing data systems and building them from the ground up. The right candidate will be excited by the prospect of optimizing or even re-designing our company’s data architecture to support our next generation of products and data initiatives.<br><br><strong><u>Responsibilities Of The Data Engineer<br></u></strong><ul><li>Create and maintain optimal data pipeline architecture,</li><li>Assemble large, complex data sets that meet functional / non-functional business requirements.</li><li>Identify, design, and implement internal process improvements: automating manual processes, optimizing data delivery, re-designing performance metrics.</li><li>Work with stakeholders including the Executive, Product, Data and Design teams to assist with data-related technical issues and support their data infrastructure title: Data Engineer
description: <strong>Senior Data Engineer (Cloud)<br><br></strong><strong>Pay: </strong>$75-$85 w2<br><br><strong>Contract Length:</strong> 6 months contract (potential extension)<br><br><strong>Location: Chicago, IL <br><br></strong>The Senior Cloud/Data Engineer will design, code, test, and analyze software programs and applications. This includes researching, designing, documenting, and modifying software specifications throughout the production lifecycle. This role will also analyze and amend software errors in a timely and accurate fashion and provide status reports where required.<br><br><strong><u>Responsibilities<br></u></strong><ul><li>Work with Product team to determine requirements and propose approaches to address users' needs</li><li>Analyze requirements to determine approach/proposed solution</li><li>Design and Build Solutions using relevant programming languages</li><li>Thoroughly test solutions using relevant approaches and tools</li><li>Conduct research into software-related issues and products</li><li>Design and develops enterprise data solutions based on architecture and standards leveraging leading architecture practices and advanced data technologies.</li><li>Implement solutions for data migration, data delivery and ML pipelines.</li><li>Implement Identity Access Management Roles and policies.</li><li>Build resilient, reliable, performant and secure Data Platform and Applications.</li><li>Automate deployments of AWS services and BI Applications.<br></li></ul><strong><u>Experience And Skills<br></u></strong><ul><li>6+ years of experience within the field of application/platform engineering or related technical work including business intelligence, analytics.</li><li>4+ years of experience with AWS Senior Cloud Data Engineering, management, maintenance, or architecting, implementing best practices and industry standards.</li><li>Experience with data warehousing platforms such as Snowflake, Redshift or similar.</li><li>Strong knowledge and established experience with AWS services including but not limited to: S3, EC2, RDS, Lambda, Cloud Formation, Kinesis, Data Pipelines, EMR, Step Functions, VPC, IAM, and Security Groups.</li><li>Experience with DB technologies (e.g., SQL, Python, PostgreSQL, AWS Aurora, AWS RDS, MongoDB, Redis).</li><li>Experience with CI/CD tools, pipelines, and scripting for automation. (GitHub Actions, Jenkins, AWS Code Pipeline tools, Cloud formation and Terraform).</li><li>High degree of knowledge in IAM Roles and Policies</li><li>Strong knowledge configuring AWS cloud monitoring and alerts for cloud resource availability.</li><li>Strong scripting experience using PowerShell and/or Python.</li><li>High degree of knowledge in PaaS and SaaS application performance.</li><li>Understand enterprise level application architecture diagrams and IT security requirements.<br></li></ul><strong><u>Must Have Skills<br></u></strong><ul><li>Experience designing and building scalable and robust data pipelines to enable data-driven decisions for the business</li><li>Effective problem solving and analytical skills. Ability to manage multiple projects and report simultaneously across different stakeholders</li><li>Rigorous attention to detail and accuracy.</li><li>Demonstrate d ability to troubleshoot technical problems and issues.</li><li>Passionate about programming and learning new technologies.</li><li>Experience planning and executing on-premises to AWS migrations</li><li>BA or BS degree Computer Engineering, Computer Science, or related fields.</li><li>Hands on experience in Java (Spring, Spring boot framework)</li><li>Hands on experience with AWS cloud architecture and development using AWS resources like S3, Lambda, API Gateway, DynamoDB, RDS, etc</li><li>Hands on experience in data pipeline development using modern ETL tools specifically on Informatica PowerCenter and/or Informatica IICS</li><li>Proficiency in SQL and Scripting (Unix sell scripts and/or Python)</li><li>Hands on experience in trouble shooting complex Application, ETL and SQL problems.<br></li></ul><strong><u>Good To Have Skills<br></u></strong><ul><li>Experience with large scale enterprise streaming services such as Kafka.</li><li>Experience with Kubernetes and Docker containers or AWS Fargate.</li><li>Experience implementing applications with both Windows and Linux server OS</li><li>Experience with networking, security groups, or policy management in relation to Cloud resources across multiple operating systems, including UNIX, Linux, or Windows</li><li>Experience with Informatica MDM</li><li>Proficiency in databases (Snowflake, DB2, Redshift, etc), database concepts and dimensional modeling</li><li>Experience in data cleansing, data validation and data wrangling<br></li></ul>#PCIT<br><br>

title: Systems Engineer
description: Contract Type: W2<br><br>Contract Duration: 6 Months, possible extension<br><br>Contract to Hire: Possible<br><br>Location: Remote - CST<br><br><strong><u>Job Purpose/Role<br><br></u></strong>Our client is seeking an IT Service Management Data and Reporting Analyst who will be the primary point of contact for the creation and management of reports and metrics measuring KPI/SLA performance across the technical landscape. You will analyze and report on program metrics and data to identify continuous improvement opportunities or corrective actions proactively. This role reports to the head of IT Service Management but supports all technical functions.<br><br><strong><u>Responsibilities<br><br></u></strong>Responsible to build out a reporting framework using ServiceNow data that serves delivery teams, executives and global partners. This includes<br><ul><li> Develop, maintain and produce operational and strategic reports and dashboards</li><li> Monitor, analyze and report on vendor and internal teams’ performance and SLA compliance</li><li> Routinely validate the accuracy of IT metrics and reporting</li><li> Utilize Performance Analytics to conduct trend analysis and analyze IT performance</li><li> Develop, prioritize and execute a roadmap for ServiceNow Reporting and Analytics</li><li> Partner with IT stakeholders to develop remediation plans to comply with audit findings, and drive issues and risks to closure</li><li> Work closely with process owners and delivery teams to support continuous improvement through data driven analysis</li><li> Lead ideation and requirement specification of reporting and other ITSM capabilities</li><li> Align closely with the global reporting team to ensure global reporting standards are understood and adhered to</li><li> Track and analyze performance, process adherence and compliance against operating targets</li><li> Develop and run periodic and ad-hoc reports in support of IT Operations and core service delivery functions</li><li> Support the design, testing and implementation of ServiceNow projects and enhancements</li><li> Assists in the preparation of presentation materials for management and others<br></li></ul><strong><u>Knowledge/Skills/Abilities<br></u></strong><ul><li> Extensive ServiceNow reporting and dashboard experience</li><li> Proficient using ServiceNow Performance Analytics</li><li> Strong customer centric orientation with the ability to work effectively with diverse teams</li><li> A strong understanding of ITSM processes Incident, Problem, Change, Request</li><li> Excellent communication skills both written and verbal</li><li> Passion for improving and simplifying processes to maximize value</li><li> Ability to translate technical specifications into business requirements and vice-versa</li><li> Ability to coordinate cross-functional teams toward task completion</li><li> Thorough attention to details, ability to multitask, and effective time management skills</li><li> Proficiency with Excel, SQL or industry standard reporting tools</li><li> Self-starter with strong technical skills and ability to learn new technologies quickly</li><li> Must be comfortable working in a fast-paced environment<br></li></ul><strong><u>Education And Experience<br></u></strong><ul><li> Bachelor’s degree in Information Systems or related field or equivalent work experience</li><li> 4+ years of ServiceNow reporting and analytics experience</li><li> 3+ years of IT Service Management</li></ul>

description: We’re building a relationship-oriented bank for the modern world. We need talented, passionate professionals who are dedicated to doing what’s right for our clients.<p><br></p>At CIBC, we embrace your strengths and your ambitions, so you are empowered at work. Our team members have what they need to make a meaningful impact and are truly valued for who they are and what they contribute.<p><br></p>To learn more about CIBC, please visit CIBC.com<p><br></p><strong>Job Description</strong><p><br></p>Overview:<p><br></p>This role requires extensive familiarity with Windows, Linux servers and frequently involves user support tasks. Expertise with the Windows operating system and server administration to develop and deploy servers, support day-to-day system performance, and prevent data loss and unauthorized access is required. This role encompasses back-end IT support for business-critical and development-related departments and personnel.<p><br></p>Responsibilities:<p><br></p><ul><li>Administer and support core Microsoft, Linux, VMware technologies and Azure resources</li><li>Install and Configure Windows Servers and Linux Server.</li><li>Develop servers and provide support to individual users to ensure that the system works reliably and quickly.</li><li>Manage server virtualization technologies like VMWare Server/ESX</li><li>Responsible for implementing, monitoring, and maintaining the instances of the on-prem and cloud infrastructure services and the servers.</li><li>Knowledge in Application Insights, service principal in Azure, NSG rule, Azure Key vault </li><li>Provide technical support and guidance to users and other administrators.</li><li>Works closely with other IT departments and vendors to answer technical questions or resolve issues with server performance and access.</li><li>Install and maintain Windows-based programs for end users and help debug applications so that they work with Windows servers.</li><li>Perform System Maintenance activities like review backups, error logs and user-reported errors and identify stable and reliable solutions.</li><li>Monitor performance to reduce interruptions and server crashes. Develop and deploy proactive solutions and setup alerts to ensure system usability across the organization.</li><li>Maintain system security by noticing faults and vulnerabilities within the server’s architecture.</li><li>Provides troubleshooting and support, including on-call rotation, after-hours support</li><li>Other duties as assigned.</li></ul><p><br></p>Qualifications:<p><br></p><ul><li>Windows/Linux administration</li><li>Azure Certification is preferred</li><li>Experience with Azure</li><li>Good knowledge of the Windows servers ( 2012 R2, 2016, 2019)</li><li>Strong problem-solving skills and ability to apply these skills to identify and resolve anomalies in system functionality and performance</li><li>Managing server virtualization technologies like VMWare Server/ESX</li><li>Group Policy design, configuration Active Directory/LDAP user and group administration</li><li>Strong communication and documentation skills</li><li>Flexible and able to adapt to a rapidly changing environment and can manage projects of varying length</li><li>Responsible, highly reliable, organized; able to work individually and collaboratively with peers</li><li>Windows system administration: 8+ years</li><li>2 years Azure experience.</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Risk &amp; Compliance:</strong><p><br></p>Our CIBC risk culture is based on employees striving to exceed the expectations of ourselves and our leadership’s identification and mitigation of risks in their daily responsibilities, not just in quarterly or annual monitoring/assessments. We all are accountable for managing risk.<p><br></p>As an employee of CIBC the incumbent must conduct themselves (and foster an environment for others) in a manner consistent with our strong risk culture. This includes:<p><br></p><ul><li>Following all aspects of the CIBC Code of Conduct, as well as all applicable CIBC policies, frameworks, guidelines, processes and controls</li><li>At all times acting in accordance with our Purpose and shared values, to achieve our Bank’s strategic goals</li><li>Understanding and following the qualitative and quantitative components of our Risk Appetite Statements</li><li>Completing all annual Corporate Mandatory Training and Testing modules, as well as any additional business-specific modules, as required and employing the learnings in daily activities and undertakings</li><li>Escalating matters through one of the appropriate channels identified in the CIBC Code of Conduct (i.e., HR, management, Ethics Hotline, Whistleblower, etc.) upon observing activities that may be inconsistent with CIBC’s policies, frameworks, guidelines, processes and controls</li><li>Speaking up if witnessing behaviors that drive poor or unfair outcomes for clients, team members or other stakeholders</li><li>Escalating matters that can result in adverse market practices and outcomes, thereby negatively impacting CIBC’s reputation as a leading financial institution</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>What You Need To Know</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>CIBC is committed to creating an inclusive environment where all team members and clients feel like they belong. We seek applicants with a wide range of abilities and we provide an accessible candidate experience. If you need accommodation, please contact Mailbox.careers-carrieres@cibc.com</li><li>You need to be legally eligible to work at the location(s) specified above and, where applicable, must have a valid work or study permit.</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Job Location</strong><p><br></p>IL-70 W Madison St, 8th Fl<p><br></p><strong>Employment Type</strong><p><br></p>Regular<p><br></p><strong>Weekly Hours</strong><p><br></p>40<p><br></p><strong>Skills</strong><p><br></p>Group Policy, Microsoft Azure Administration, Server Administration, VMware ESXi, VMware Server, Windows System Administration

title: LWC Developer
description: Business Intelligence (BI) Developer needs 5+ years experience<br><br><strong><u>Business Intelligence (BI) Developer Requires<br><br></u></strong> Must have strong experience with Reporting Tools Business Objects and Tableau (3-5 years)<br><br> Must have strong experience with writing SQL (3-5 years)<br><br> Good to have experience with Oracle Data Integrator (1 year)<br><br> Good to have experience with Python programming (1 year)<br><br> Good Team Player Strong Communication skill<br><br><strong><u>Business Intelligence (BI) Developer Duties<br><br></u></strong> Collaborates as a member of a project team with academic and administrative units to implement and support business intelligence solutions to satisfy information requirements for planning and decision making, using data from core administrative systems.<br><br> Works with a Senior BI Analyst to define BI requirements for individual subject areas, develop conceptual data models, design, build, and test a robust set of reporting and analytic BI deliverables using the standard BI tool, Business Objects (BO), Tableau and rollout the solution including training and ongoing support.<br><br> Work with the training lead to implement training, communication, and support programs across campus.<br><br> Key BI analysis and development resource for new subject areas and reporting deliverable enhancements<br><br>Employment Type: Full-Time<br><br>Salary: $ 83.00 Per Hour

title: Business Intelligence (BI) Developer
description: <strong><u>Company Description<br><br></u></strong>RedMane Technology LLC is an application software consulting and systems integration company based in Chicago. We deliver software solutions for our clients throughout the United States and Canada by means of building new applications, implementing cloud and packaged systems, and/or modernizing legacy systems.<br><br>RedMane has earned an exemplary service reputation that prioritizes a highly collaborative culture. Our primary objective is to ensure the solutions we design and implement meet or exceed the needs of our clients for their mission critical systems.<br><br>The diverse and passionate teams within RedMane address complex, real world challenges. Technology is just our tool.<br><br><strong>The Role<br><br></strong>RedMane has a full-time opportunity for an application developer as we continue to grow our Chicago based practice. The application developer will perform development for our no code / low code, highly configurable SaaS product. This product incorporates leading-edge technologies, from cloud-based mobility to data visualizations and artificial intelligence. The developer will work on a dynamic development team in an Agile/Scrum environment to deliver a customized solution for our clients.<br><br><strong><u>Skills &amp; Role Requirements<br><br></u></strong>The Application Developer will need to have:<br><ul><li>3+ years of experience in software development, preferably in a C#, JavaScript, .NET, and SQL Server environment.</li><li>1+ years of experience with Node.js, GoJs, Angular, or similar technologies.</li><li>Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or other field.</li><li>Strong attention to detail and problem-solving skills.</li><li>Highly self-motivated with the ability to work independently.</li><li>Proven ability to efficiently learn and apply new ideas and concepts.</li><li>Ability to organize time, staff, and projects efficiently.<br></li></ul>All professionals at RedMane are expected to possess these qualities:<br><ul><li>A strong ethical foundation, capable of thriving in an environment and culture where honesty, integrity, and accountability are core values.</li><li>A collaborative spirit, a team orientation, and a willingness and desire to contribute to the success of others.<br></li></ul><strong>We Offer You<br><br></strong>RedMane has an environment that offers challenging and interesting work. A place where you can have fun and express your talent and creativity. You will be working side by side with like-minded peers in a non-bureaucratic environment where sharing knowledge is the norm. Everyone at RedMane shares a passion for making a real difference for individuals, communities, and the world.<br><br><strong><u>RedMane Is Very Proud To Offer Employees Professional And Personal Perks That Include<br><br></u></strong>Additionally, we believe you should have fun and enjoy growing your career; we provide the supportive and empowering environment to make it happen.<br><ul><li>A flexible work environment that includes hybridized locations and schedules with free catered lunches in the office three days a week. </li><li>Market based compensation with a full range of benefits including medical, dental, vision, 401(k), short and long-term disability insurance, etc. </li><li>A culture that promotes and fosters career growth through professional training and mentoring. </li><li>An employee wellness program that includes free access to professional fitness coaches, structured dietary/nutrition plans, weekly Pilates classes in the office, and events that range from 5ks to triathlons. </li><li>Opportunities to give back to the community through our RedMane Community Impact Team which organizes events like Feed My Starving Children, Toy Drives, and other charitable activities.</li></ul>

title: SFDC - LWC Developers
description: <p><strong>Title</strong>: Sr Linux Engineer</p><p><strong>Duration</strong>: 6-month contract to hire </p><p><strong>Location</strong>: Onsite 1x/month </p><p><strong>Pay</strong>: $60-$70/hr (converting between 120k-140k)</p><p><br></p><p>Day-to-Day </p><p>Insight Global' s largest healthcare manufacturing client has an immediate need for a senior Linux engineer to join a team of highly talented and motivated individuals operating within a complex enterprise and hybrid cloud environment. We are seeking a subject matter expert that maintains that sense of curiosity and strives to find innovative ways to solve problems and enjoys doing so in a team-based environment where mentoring and collaboration are critical to the success of the organization. This is a high-profile role within the company that offers the opportunity to make an immediate impact and allows for individual growth and advancement. This opportunity is a remote role with minimal onsite requirements. </p><p> MAJOR RESPONSIBILITIES Design, build, configuration (low-level), documentation, and administration of server-based operating systems on physical and virtual hardware. Perform advanced monitoring and troubleshooting of system related issues including performance tuning and root cause analysis. Participate in the management and maintenance of one or more Microsoft Azure tenants. Participate in Disaster Recovery deployment, administration, and testing activities. Participate in architecture design meetings related to new projects and new system deployments. Define processes and procedures and be an escalation point for the Operations team</p>

We are seeking a subject matter expert that maintains that sense of curiosity and strives to find innovative ways to solve problems and enjoys doing so in a team-based environment where mentoring and collaboration are critical to the success of the organization. This is a high-profile role within the company that offers the opportunity to make an immediate impact and allows for individual growth and advancement. This opportunity is a remote role with minimal onsite requirements. </p><p> MAJOR RESPONSIBILITIES Design, build, configuration (low-level), documentation, and administration of server-based operating systems on physical and virtual hardware. Perform advanced monitoring and troubleshooting of system related issues including performance tuning and root cause analysis. Participate in the management and maintenance of one or more Microsoft Azure tenants. Participate in Disaster Recovery deployment, administration, and testing activities. Participate in architecture design meetings related to new projects and new system deployments. Define processes and procedures and be an escalation point for the Operations team</p>

title: Hybrid Linux Engineer
description: At our digital media company, we're passionate about connecting consumers with the world's leading brands. With a diverse portfolio of brands and technologies, we strive to be the most innovative and tech-enabled media company out there. Our headquarters is located in vibrant downtown Delray Beach, Florida, and our dynamic team spans across over a dozen countries. We attribute our success to our energetic culture and a high-performing, entrepreneurial spirit.<br><br>YOUR ROLE<br><br>We're in search of a highly motivated and data-driven professional to join our credit cards vertical. As a key member of our team, you'll leverage your analytical skills to optimize and manage the daily operations of the business. Reporting directly to the VP of Operations &amp; Growth, you'll collaborate closely with cross-functional teams to optimize campaigns and ensure the success of the vertical.<br><br>As the subject matter expert in this vertical, you'll be responsible for standardizing reporting and conducting ad hoc analysis to identify growth opportunities. Your ability to deliver insightful, accurate, and actionable data insights through strategic partnerships will earn you the team's confidence and directly impact your success.<br><br>SUCCESS IN THIS ROLE MEANS<br><br>Analyzing and interpreting digital marketing data across various channels, website performance, and advertiser conversion to proactively suggest improvements and boost ROI.<br><br>Collaborating with cross-functional teams, including paid media, content, design, and product, to develop and implement data-driven marketing initiatives aligned with business goals.<br><br>Assisting in the execution of A/B testing plans to optimize website performance, media buying, and other digital marketing strategies.<br><br>Managing marketplace operations, monitoring KPIs throughout the entire sales funnel, tracking volume trends, and updating forecasting models.<br><br>Optimizing business performance and creating forward-looking projections to drive growth in the Credit Card vertical.<br><br>Tracking advertiser performance, conducting product analysis, cross-category comparisons, and monitoring partner key success metrics.<br><br>Compiling business proposals and partner-facing materials by pulling and analyzing relevant data sets.<br><br>Building reports and dashboards to support compliance, account management, and marketing teams.<br><br>Conducting regular competitive analysis to identify industry trends and opportunities.<br><br>Effectively communicating updates and changes to the team.<br><br>Contributing to ad-hoc analytical projects.<br><br><strong><u>What You Need To Succeed<br><br></u></strong>1-2 years of experience in a digital marketing analyst role, preferably within the financial services industry.<br><br>Bachelor's degree in Finance, Marketing, Business, Statistics, or a related field.<br><br>Proven experience working with complex data sets.<br><br>Demonstrated ability to collaborate effectively with cross-functional teams.<br><br>Experience in a similar role involving business analytics and operations management.<br><br>Expertise in Excel and/or Google Sheets, including pivot tables and advanced formulas.<br><br>NICE TO HAVES<br><br>Experience with Looker (preferred), Tableau, PowerBI, or other reporting and analytics tools, including report and dashboard creation.<br><br>Proficiency in SQL, SSAS, or other database/analysis packages.<br><br>Familiarity with performance marketing and lead generation.<br><br>Previous experience in the credit card industry is highly preferred.<br><br>Ready to make an impact in a profitable, high-growth company? Apply now!<br><br>We've always been committed to fostering a diverse and inclusive team and culture since day one. As an Equal Employment Opportunity company, we value diversity, equity, and inclusion. We do not discriminate based on race, religion, color, national origin, gender (including pregnancy, childbirth, or related medical conditions), sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, age, status as a protected veteran, status as an individual with a disability, or any other legally protected characteristics.<br><br>Employment Type: Full-Time<br><br>Salary: $ 39,000.00 121,000.00 Per Year

tables and advanced formulas.<br><br>NICE TO HAVES<br><br>Experience with Looker (preferred), Tableau, PowerBI, or other reporting and analytics tools, including report and dashboard creation.<br><br>Proficiency in SQL, SSAS, or other database/analysis packages.<br><br>Familiarity with performance marketing and lead generation.<br><br>Previous experience in the credit card industry is highly preferred.<br><br>Ready to make an impact in a profitable, high-growth company? Apply now!<br><br>We've always been committed to fostering a diverse and inclusive team and culture since day one. As an Equal Employment Opportunity company, we value diversity, equity, and inclusion. We do not discriminate based on race, religion, color, national origin, gender (including pregnancy, childbirth, or related medical conditions), sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, age, status as a protected veteran, status as an individual with a disability, or any other legally protected characteristics.<br><br>Employment Type: Full-Time<br><br>Salary: $ 39,000.00 121,000.00 Per Year

title: Business Associate - Remote | WFH
description: We inspire purpose-filled living that brings joy to the modern home. With a team of more than 8,000 associates spanning 130 store and distribution locations across the U.S. and Canada, we achieve together, drive results and innovate to inspire. Drawn together by a shared passion for our customers and a spirit of fun, we deliver high-quality home furnishings that are expertly designed, responsibly sourced and bring beauty and function to people’s homes. From the day we opened our first store in Chicago in 1962 to the digital innovations that engage millions of customers today, our iconic brand is over 60 years in the making—and our story is still unfolding.<p><br></p>We’re here for it. We think you should be too. We’re looking for a driven professional with an inclusive mindset to join our team as a <strong> Systems Engineer </strong><p><br></p>The Systems Engineer will be responsible for building, configuring and deploying critical infrastructure used across the organization. They will be responsible for providing 24x7 operational support along with executing infrastructure related projects. This is a combination of infrastructure administration, engineering, and architecture.<p><br></p>This is a hybrid position based out of our Northbrook, IL office. This role can be worked remotely the majority of the time, and will only require travel to the office for and will only require travel into the office when necessary (likely a couple times a year).<p><br></p><strong> A day in the life as a Systems Engineer… </strong><p><br></p><ul><li> Partnering with technical administrators, application developers, and other technical peers to create robust, scalable infrastructure solutions </li><li> Coordinating and executing projects associated with the installation, configuration and deployment of compute, storage, and virtualization technologies </li><li> Providing operational and project status reports </li><li> Contributing and supporting disaster recovery activities and strategy </li><li> Performing patch management activities for critical infrastructure </li><li> Scripting and automating routine tasks </li><li> Participating in annual business audits and providing all related documentation to appropriate team(s) </li><li> Participating in the evaluation of new infrastructure technologies </li><li> Recommending optimizations to the environment which improve delivery and performance for end users and customers </li><li> Establishing standard operating procedures for building and deploying infrastructure </li><li> Resolving incidents and work orders escalated from the Service Desk </li><li> Providing technical training to Service Desk, Operations, and relevant parties </li><li> Serving as after hour, weekend and holiday support, as necessary </li><li> Maintaining and supporting infrastructure at remote locations </li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>What You’ll Bring To The Table…</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li> Ability to work autonomously with minimal supervision </li><li> Strong attention to detail and interpersonal skills </li><li> Ability to write and present information and documentation </li><li> Strong ability to manage multiple issues at once </li><li> Strong working knowledge of server, storage and virtualization technologies within a hybrid-cloud environment </li><li> Ability to Collaborate with technical peers across a highly dispersed work environment </li><li> Communicate effectively and efficiently with all company associates and business units including executive leadership </li><li> Maintain awareness of industry best practices and partner with management to ensure these are applied appropriately </li></ul><p><br></p><strong> We’d love to hear from you if you have… </strong><p><br></p><ul><li> Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science or a related field </li><li> 5+ Years Systems Engineering experience in a hybrid-cloud environment </li><li> Hands-on experience with a mix of server, storage, and virtualization technologies </li><li> Working knowledge and hands-on experience integrating with public cloud providers (AWS, Azure, GCP) </li><li> Strong understanding of core system administration concepts (e.g., patch management, OS layout and integrity, security, hardening and service management, backup, restore, monitoring and maintenance) </li><li> Basic scripting capabilities in at least one scripting language for system administration automation on one OS (e.g., PowerShell, VB, WMI or PowerCLI)</li></ul>

description: <p><strong>Position: IBM BPM Developer</strong></p><p><strong>Location: Chicago, IL</strong></p><p><br></p><p><br></p><p><span>&nbsp;</span></p><ol><li><span>Minimum 8 years of IT Experience with minimum of 5 years IBM BPM Development with certification.</span></li><li><span>At least 2 project implementation in IBM BPM 8.0 or above</span></li><li><span>Very good written verbal communication Can connect with Business Stakeholders understand the business</span></li><li><span>Primary Skills Must have Very good understanding of BPMN 2 0</span></li><li><span>Very good knowledge on Coach &amp; BPM UI (Spark UI) implementation</span></li><li><span>Good knowledge on REST API its implementation</span></li><li><span>Must have implemented Web services integration services controls the flow of process execution decision making and exception management across multiple organizational roles and systems applications</span></li><li><span>Tailors user screens for each process activity to enable end users to interact with multiple internal external systems through a single interface</span></li><li><span>Good database skills with excellent query writing skills</span></li><li><span>Can build the executable processes with limited requirement to showcase business</span></li><li><span>Knowledge on Content Management System &amp; its integration with IBM BPM.</span></li></ol><p><span>&nbsp;</span></p><p><span>&nbsp;</span></p>

title: W2 Contract Opportunity-Java Developer-Chicago,IL
description: <strong>Discover. A brighter future.</strong><p><br></p>With us, you’ll do meaningful work from Day 1. Our collaborative culture is built on three core behaviors: We Play to Win, We Get Better Every Day &amp; We Succeed Together. And we mean it — we want you to grow and make a difference at one of the world's leading digital banking and payments companies. We value what makes you unique so that you have an opportunity to shine.<p><br></p>Come build your future, while being the reason millions of people find a brighter financial future with Discover.<p><br></p><strong>Job Description:</strong><p><br></p>At Discover, be part of a culture where diversity, teamwork, and collaboration reign. Join a company that is just as employee focused as it is on its customers and is consistently awarded for both. <strong>We’re all about people, and our employees are why Discover <em>is </em>a great place to work. </strong>Be the reason we help millions of consumers build a brighter financial future and achieve yours along the way with a rewarding career.<p><br></p>The Infrastructure Engineer works on holistic engineering deliverables across different stages of the product lifecycle and determines technology patterns for the overall solution. This role takes the lead in guiding more junior engineers and is a role model in fostering the adoption of new technologies. Actively manages and escalates risk and customer-impacting issues within the day-to-day role to management.<p><br></p><strong>Responsibilities</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Achieves product commitments (and influences others to do the same) by using informal leadership &amp; highly developed communication skills and contributes to or led technology communities </li><li>Uses automation, system tools, open-source solutions, observability and 'security first' principles in daily work </li><li>Contributes to team agile ceremonies, leads demos and presentations, helps new engineers learn established norms </li><li>Initiates high level solution design approaches, and guides team to achieve desired key software delivery capabilities using automated, coded enterprise and observability </li><li>Participates in internal speaking and advocacy events </li><li>Supports research activities to adopt new technology solutions in ways of developing new capabilities </li><li>Continues professional education and creates opportunities for core product teams to learn engineering best practices </li><li>Coaches immediate chapter and actively fosters the adoption of new technologies </li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Minimum Qualifications</strong><p><br></p><strong>At a minimum, here’s what we need from you:</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Bachelors – Computer Science or related </li><li>3+ Years – (Software) Engineering, DevOps or related </li><li>Internal applicants only: technical proficiency rating of competent on the Dreyfus engineering scale </li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Preferred Qualifications</strong><p><br></p><strong>Bonus Points If You Have:</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Ansible Tower / Automation Platform installation and administration skills on physical and OpenShift deployments</li><li>Experience writing Playbooks and assisting others in their automation journey.</li><li>Strong Linux skills</li><li>Python, Bash, YAML, Groovy, Ruby, Java, PowerShell scripting experience</li><li>Additional skills include vRealize Automation, Chef, NSX, Vault, GitHub, and Jira experience.</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Compensation:</strong><p><br></p>The base pay for this position generally ranges between $84,500.00 to $142,500.00. Additional incentives may be provided as part of a market competitive total compensation package. Factors, such as but not limited to, geographical location, relevant experience, education, and skill level may impact the pay for this position.<p><br></p><strong><strong><strong>Benefits:</strong></strong></strong><p><br></p>We also offer a range of benefits and programs based on eligibility. These benefits include:<p><br></p><ul><li>Paid Parental Leave</li><li>Paid Time Off</li><li>401(k) Plan</li><li>Medical, Dental, Vision, &amp; Health Savings Account</li><li>STD, Life, LTD and AD&amp;D</li><li>Recognition Program</li><li>Education Assistance</li><li>Commuter Benefits</li><li>Family Support Programs</li><li>Employee Stock Purchase Plan</li></ul><p><br></p>Learn more at MyDiscoverBenefits.com.<p><br></p>What are you waiting for? Apply today!<p><br></p>All Discover employees place our customers at the very center of our work. To deliver on our promises to our customers, each of us contribute every day to a culture that values compliance and risk management.<p><br></p>Discover is committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace. Discover is an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate on the basis of race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability, protected veteran status, or other legally protected status. (Know Your Rights)

description: <strong><u>Job Description</u></strong><p><br></p>Hello<p><br></p><strong> Hope you are doing well today ! </strong><p><br></p>We are currently hiring for <strong> Salesforce Developers with LWC </strong>for my client . title: Infrastructure Engineer
description: We’re building a relationship-oriented bank for the modern world. We need talented, passionate professionals who are dedicated to doing what’s right for our clients.<p><br></p>At CIBC, we embrace your strengths and your ambitions, so you are empowered at work. Our team members have what they need to make a meaningful impact and are truly valued for who they are and what they contribute.<p><br></p>To learn more about CIBC, please visit CIBC.com<p><br></p><strong>Job Description</strong><p><br></p>You will be joining CIBC’s US Infrastructure Planning &amp; Engineering team. The Infrastructure Engineer to manage our organization's IT infrastructure, ensuring its smooth operation and optimal performance.<p><br></p>The ideal candidate will possess a strong background in VMware technologies, Active Directory, Exchange and SMTP relay, EMC storage, physical server technologies, and related Azure services. This role requires a deep understanding of infrastructure management, coupled with excellent technical skills and the ability to lead and collaborate with a team.<p><br></p><strong>How You Will Succeed</strong><p><br></p>You can demonstrate and responsible for the following:<p><br></p><ul><li>Manage and maintain the organization's IT infrastructure, including servers, storage, virtualization platforms, and related systems.</li><li>Ensure the availability, reliability, and performance of the infrastructure components, addressing any issues promptly and efficiently.</li><li>Oversee the design, implementation, and administration of VMware technologies, including vSphere, VCenter, and VSAN.</li><li>Manage Active Directory services, including user accounts, group policies, security, and access controls.</li><li>Administer Exchange server and SMTP relay services, ensuring smooth email communication and system integrity.</li><li>Monitor and optimize EMC storage systems, ensuring efficient data storage, backup, and disaster recovery processes.</li><li>Provide technical expertise and guidance in the evaluation, selection, and implementation of physical server technologies.</li><li>Collaborate with cross-functional teams to design and implement infrastructure solutions that meet business needs and align with industry best practices.</li><li>Stay up to date with emerging technologies and industry trends, making recommendations for continuous improvement and innovation.</li><li>Ensure compliance with security standards, data privacy regulations, and disaster recovery policies.</li><li>Lead and mentor a team of infrastructure professionals, fostering a culture of collaboration, knowledge sharing, and continuous learning.</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Who You Are</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>You have a Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, or a related field (or equivalent experience).</li><li>You have proven experience in infrastructure management, preferably in a leadership role.</li><li>In-depth knowledge and hands-on experience with VMware technologies, including vSphere, vCenter, and vSAN.</li><li>Strong expertise in Active Directory administration, group policies, and security management.</li><li>Proficiency in managing Exchange server and SMTP relay services.</li><li>Experience with EMC storage systems, data storage optimization, and backup and recovery strategies.</li><li>Solid understanding of physical server technologies, server virtualization, and related hardware components.</li><li>Familiarity with Azure services and cloud infrastructure is highly desirable.</li><li>Excellent problem-solving and troubleshooting skills, with the ability to analyze complex issues and implement effective solutions.</li><li>Strong communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to work collaboratively with diverse teams and stakeholders.</li><li>Certifications in relevant technologies (such as VMware, Microsoft, EMC) are a plus.</li><li>If you are a results-oriented professional with a passion for infrastructure management and a solid background in VMware technologies, Active Directory, Exchange, storage, and related technologies, we invite you to apply for this exciting opportunity. Join our team and contribute to the stability and growth of our organization's IT infrastructure.</li></ul><p><br></p>California residents — your privacy rights regarding your actual or prospective employment<p><br></p><strong>What CIBC Offers</strong><p><br></p>At CIBC, our people are our greatest asset. You’ll become part of a diverse community that acknowledges everyone’s unique talents, and empowers teams to do what’s right for the client and to do it well. As part of our team, you will<strong>:</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Thrive: Benefit from an open and approachable culture that provides the flexibility and support you need to integrate your life at work and home.</li><li>Connect: Work in a place where the right technology and infrastructure foster innovation, collaboration, and creativity.</li><li>Develop: Grow your skills and career through our best-in-class onboarding experience, ongoing learning opportunities, individual development planning, and comprehensive product training.</li><li>Prosper: Share in our collective success with a competitive salary, incentive pay, banking benefits, health benefits programs, retirement savings, and more</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>What You Need To Know</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>CIBC is committed to creating an inclusive environment where all team members and clients feel like they belong. We seek applicants with a wide range of abilities and we provide an accessible candidate experience. If you need accommodation, please contact Mailbox.careers-carrieres@cibc.com</li><li>You need to be legally eligible to work at the location(s) specified above and, where applicable, must have a valid work or study permit.</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Job Location</strong><p><br></p>IL-70 W Madison St, 8th Fl<p><br></p><strong>Employment Type</strong><p><br></p>Regular<p><br></p><strong>Weekly Hours</strong><p><br></p>40<p><br></p><strong>Skills</strong><p><br></p>Active Directory (AD), Azure Active Directory (AD), Backup and Recovery (Software), Disaster Recovery (DR), Infrastructure Management (IM), Quest Migration Manager for Active Directory, VMware

title: salesforce with LWC developer
description: <strong><u>Company Overview</u></strong><p><br></p>Intertape Polymer Group (IPG) is a dynamic multinational organization that prides itself on its corporate culture of a family atmosphere that meets high achieving company performance. We are known for our competitive salaries and benefits packages and our emphasis on putting people first. Founded in 1982, and now grown to $1.5B in sales worldwide, IPG focuses on growth through organic and strategic means. Our diversified product lines support our mission to be the world leader in packaging and protective solutions. Come join the IPG family today! Find out more at our website.<p><br></p><strong>Position Purpose:</strong> This position will join a dynamic engineering team, work with an industry leader and be expected to sustain a high performing customer-centric environment. This position will contribute to designing and manufacturing high quality, high efficiency cartoners, case packers, pouch packaging systems, and robotics integration. Our products are used worldwide in most major industries including Food, Pharma, Confections, Cosmetic, Beverage and many others. As an Applications Engineer you will use your technical skills to identify and provide dependable solutions for our diverse customer base. The Applications Engineer is the first line of support for our product line and is responsible for providing complete customer satisfaction regarding the use and implementation of our superior packaging solutions.<p><br></p><strong><u>Principle Accountabilities</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Utilize sound engineering principles to plan, conceptualize and design new products or modify existing ones from information provided by customer request/feedback, sales/sales engineers, manufacturing personnel or service team under supervision of Senior Engineers or Engineering Manager.</li><li>Pre-sale and post-sale technical support</li><li>Collaborate with development team to drive core product growth</li><li>Develop custom solutions for customers and industry partners</li><li>Create and present technical training curriculums</li><li>Test and evaluate existing as well as new technologies on equipment and software performance and reliability.</li><li>Assist in the coordination of any new projects by utilizing your full potential.</li><li>Assist staff in any technical issues which may require attention.</li><li>Assist in the coordination of design and manufacture of customs tooling for placement equipment.</li><li>Travel to customer and industry partner facilities to execute projects and conduct advanced technical training sessions</li><li>Cultivate an array of business relationships within the manufacturing sector</li><li>Support applications by providing automation concepts and concept drawings in preparation of estimates and quotes.</li><li>Stay current in new developments within industries served. Keeps informed of new applications and methods to improve systems or products.</li><li>Travels up to 30%</li><li>Related tasks as requested by supervisor.</li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>Essential Skills And Experience</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Bachelor's degree in Mechanical Engineering</li><li>5+ years of documented engineering experience, automated packaging experience preferred.</li><li>Experience in robotics programming not required but must be willing to learn.</li><li>Creative mindset with attention to detail of process, product, and material design</li><li>Strong AutoCAD/AutoDesk and SolidWorks proficiency required.</li><li>Strong understanding of automation electronics</li><li>Familiar with the following manufacturing technologies: Machining, Forming, Welding, Heat Treatment</li><li>Experience designing Cartoners, Case Packers, Pouch Machines, Palletizers, and Robotics.</li><li>Willingness to bring a team together and accomplish project goals effectively.</li><li>Ability to multi-task while maintaining attention to detail and deadlines.</li><li>Excellent verbal and written communication skills</li><li>Team-oriented and collaborative - general focus on pleasing the customer.</li><li>Creative-thinking and problem-solving skills</li><li>Maintain current knowledge of competitive technologies and ability to learn new technologies.</li><li>Aptitude and willingness to be a self-starter</li><li>Willingness to work as required to meet schedules</li></ul><p><br></p><strong><em>Job Posted by ApplicantPro</em></strong>

title: Infrastructure Engineer (multiple openings) - IHM
description: We are excited to present an amazing opportunity to join our team as an Application Developer! As part of our IT Software Engineering Services practice, you will play a key role in developing, enhancing, and supporting enterprise applications and integrations. We are seeking a talented individual who not only possesses a solid understanding of software engineering concepts but also embraces agile methodologies, object-oriented design, and industry best practices.<br><br>Why join us?<br><br>Embrace change: We value flexibility and adaptability, creating an environment where you can thrive in a dynamic work landscape.<br><br>Progress over perfection: We prioritize making progress and taking meaningful steps forward, rather than striving for perfection.<br><br>Make a difference: Your work will directly impact and improve the lives of the people we serve, giving you a sense of purpose and fulfillment.<br><br>Build relationships: We believe in the power of collaboration and encourage you to develop strong relationships with your colleagues and business partners.<br><br>Speak up: Your voice matters, and we value open communication. Share your ideas while considering the impact on our culture and overall output.<br><br>High standards: We hold ourselves and our team members to the highest standards, fostering an environment of excellence and continuous growth.<br><br><strong><u>Responsibilities<br><br></u></strong>Develop and support internal and public applications to meet business requirements, preferably as a Full-Stack Developer.<br><br>Create custom user interfaces, including web APIs, data files, and streamed data, for seamless data exchange with external vendors and business partners.<br><br>Design secure integrations based on business needs with external vendors, partners, and business units, utilizing technologies such as serverless functions, lambdas, cron jobs, and streamed data/events processors.<br><br>Adhere to web and internet application development best practices, ensuring code documentation, and writing/maintaining test cases for all custom development.<br><br>Prioritize security by following best practices for web applications and data exchange, adhering to SOX and HIPAA regulations throughout the software development and maintenance process.<br><br>Take ownership of release cycles, implementing and deploying new features and updates to existing applications and code.<br><br>Collaborate with IT and developers across the organization to integrate systems and streamline operations.<br><br>Participate in planning and analysis of business requirements for system changes and enhancements.<br><br>Engage with internal stakeholders to understand business, functional, and technical requirements, contributing to application design, configuration, testing, and deployment.<br><br>Utilize DevOps best practices for operational support, enhancements, and bug fixes within the enterprise and integration software.<br><br><strong><u>Required Skills/Abilities<br><br></u></strong>5+ years of experience in web and cloud development using mainstream technologies.<br><br>In-depth knowledge of designing and developing efficient and secure RESTful web APIs.<br><br>Proficiency in relational databases, SQL languages, data modeling, and ETL tools.<br><br>Experience with AWS, including development, configuration, and deployment.<br><br>Familiarity with SSO/authentication technologies like SAML and platforms such as Okta.<br><br>Understanding of security integration paradigms and best practices.<br><br>Strong attention to detail, excellent multitasking abilities, and task prioritization skills.<br><br>Outstanding troubleshooting skills and a proactive approach to problem-solving.<br><br>Knowledge of software development processes and best practices.<br><br>Familiarity with DevOps principles and practices in cloud environments.<br><br>Experience with complex business systems integration, as well as object-oriented design patterns and development.<br><br>Exceptional interpersonal and communication skills.<br><br><strong><u>Education And Experience<br><br></u></strong>Bachelor's degree required in Computer Science, MIS, or equivalent.<br><br>3+ years of experience with Microsoft .NET and .NET Core platforms, including ASP.NET, C#, and MuleSoft Platform.<br><br>3+ years of design and development experience with Microsoft SQL Server or other relational databases.<br><br>2+ years of experience in AWS development and Cloud DevOps.<br><br>Strong knowledge and experience with one popular web framework (React, Angular, Svelte, jQuery, etc.) required.<br><br>Proficiency in CSS required, knowledge of the Tailwind CSS framework preferred.<br><br>Experience in designing and developing microservice applications on AWS strongly preferred.<br><br>Strong experience in developing public-facing web applications with a focus on security in design and implementation.<br><br>Excellent organizational, verbal, and written communication skills.<br><br>Experience with data/event streaming technologies (Kafka, Azure Event Hub, webhooks, etc.) preferred.<br><br>Passion for working with the latest tools, technologies, and methodologies, including new JavaScript/CSS frameworks and cloud technologies.<br><br>Desire to work in a fast-paced, collaborative, and team-based support environment.<br><br>Join our team and be part of a dynamic and innovative organization that values your expertise and provides opportunities for professional growth. Apply now to embark on an exciting journey with us as an Application Developer!<br><br>Employment Type: Full-Time<br><br>Salary: $ 110,000.00 180,000.00 Per Year

title: Infrastructure Engineer
description: <strong>Description</strong><p><br></p>Our client, a design agency, is in need of a freelance WordPress Developer to assist with the development of a client's website. The website will be a single-page site, with one potential microsite, involving simple case studies. The website will be video-heavy, so a key piece is ensuring that the site will not lag. The WordPress Developer will assist with development through the QA process. The site includes all custom fields, no themes.<p><br></p><strong>Requirements</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>2+ years' experience as a WordPress Developer</li><li>Must be comfortable with custom builds, no themes</li><li>QA experience</li><li>Managing videos and SVG animations </li></ul><p><br></p>Innovation starts with people.®<p><br></p>Robert Half is the world’s first and largest specialized talent solutions firm that connects highly qualified job seekers to opportunities at great companies. We offer contract, temporary and permanent placement solutions for finance and accounting, technology, marketing and creative, legal, and administrative and customer support roles.<p><br></p>Robert Half puts you in the best position to succeed by advocating on your behalf and promoting you to employers. We provide access to top jobs, competitive compensation and benefits, and free online training. Stay on top of every opportunity – even on the go.<p><br></p>All applicants applying for U.S. job openings must be legally authorized to work in the United States. Benefits are available to contract/temporary professionals, including medical, vision, dental, and life and disability insurance. Hired contract/temporary professionals are also eligible to enroll in our company 401(k) plan. Visit<p><br></p>© 2023 Robert Half. An Equal Opportunity Employer. M/F/Disability/Veterans.
