title: Infrastructure Engineer
description: CLA is a top 10 national professional services firm where <strong>our purpose is to <em>create opportunities</em></strong> every day, for our clients, our people, and our communities through industry-focused wealth advisory, digital, audit, tax, consulting, and outsourcing services. Even with more than 8,500 people, 130 U.S. locations, and a global reach, we promise to know you and help you.<br><br>CLA is dedicated to building a culture that invites different beliefs and perspectives to the table, so we can truly know and help our clients, communities, and each other.<br><br><strong><u>Our Perks<br></u></strong><ul><li>Flexible PTO (designed to offer flexible time away for you!)</li><li>Up to 12 weeks paid parental leave</li><li>Paid Volunteer Time Off</li><li>Mental health coverage</li><li>Quarterly Wellness stipend</li><li>Fertility benefits</li><li>Complete list of benefits here<br></li></ul>CLA is looking to grow its family by adding a Power Platform Developer to join our Enterprise Business Solutions family.<br><br><strong><u>Position Summary<br><br></u></strong>The Power Platform Developer works closely with internal IT, Digital services and our Citizen Developers to develop point solutions and drive adoption of the Power Platform. The focus of this position is to be the main point of contact for internal client application and automation requests built on the Power Platform. As a Power Platform developer and a key member of the M365 team, you will also be responsible for Platform development standards, and promoting and assisting Citizen development efforts.<br><br><strong><u>Job Functions<br></u></strong><ul><li>Functional and technical knowledge of the Power Platform (Dataverse, Apps, Flows, Bots), SharePoint, Teams and related platforms within the M365 ecosystem.</li><li>Plan, design, develop and implement Power Platform solutions following development, compliance, governance, and security best practices, working alongside internal IT development teams as well as with business units and stakeholders.</li><li>Work with teams to ensure ALM and SDLC best practices are followed.</li><li>Ability to create Components, Solutions, and develop UI/UX standards and templates.</li><li>Participate in, or lead, sessions with customers to iteratively gather and refine requirements.</li><li>Provide technical advice to team members and help drive the adoption of Power Platform cloud solutions.<br></li></ul><strong><u>Requirements<br></u></strong><ul><li>3+ years developing low-code solutions, specifically Power Apps (Canvas and Model-driven) and Power Automate</li><li>Experience with creating custom data connectors and familiarity with creating and implementing Azure app registrations.</li><li>Customization/configuration experience with SharePoint, Office 365 and MS Dynamics</li><li>Understanding of CI/CD and Azure DevOps preferred.</li><li>Knowledge of JavaScript and Azure Functions is a plus.<br></li></ul><strong>Education<br></strong><ul><li> Bachelor's Degree or experience acceptable in lieu of bachelor’s degree.<br></li></ul>Equal Opportunity Employer /AA Employer/Minorities/Women/Protected Veterans/Individuals with Disabilities.<br><br>Click here to learn about your hiring rights.<br><br><strong>Wellness at CLA<br><br></strong>To support our CLA family members, we focus on their physical, financial, social, and emotional well-being and offer comprehensive benefit options that include health, dental, vision, 401k and much more.<br><br>To view a complete list of benefits click here.<br><br>

title: Applications Engineer
description: <strong>Duration</strong>: 2+ months<p><br></p><strong><u>Job Description</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>We are seeking a highly skilled Java Production Support Engineer to join our team and provide technical support for our Java-based applications in a production environment. </li><li>The ideal candidate should have a solid background in Java development and possess strong troubleshooting and problem-solving skills. </li><li>As a Production Support Engineer, you will be responsible for ensuring the smooth operation of our applications, resolving issues, and optimizing performance to meet service level agreements (SLAs). </li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>Responsibilities</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Monitor and maintain the stability, availability, and performance of Application in a production environment. </li><li>Respond to incidents and service requests, promptly diagnosing and resolving issues to minimize downtime.</li><li>Collaborate with development teams to analyze application logs, troubleshoot problems, and implement effective solutions.</li><li>Perform root cause analysis for recurring issues, identify areas for improvement, and implement preventive measures.</li><li>Conduct performance tuning and optimization activities to enhance application performance and scalability.</li><li>Develop and maintain technical documentation, including standard operating procedures (SOPs), troubleshooting guides, and knowledge base articles.</li><li>Coordinate with stakeholders, including business users, infrastructure teams, and third-party vendors, to ensure seamless operation of the applications.</li><li>Proactively monitor system health, identify potential bottlenecks, and propose and implement proactive measures to improve system reliability.</li><li>Participate in on-call rotations and provide 24/7 support as required.</li><li>Stay updated with industry trends and emerging technologies related to Java development and production support. </li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>Requirements</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Minimum of 4 years of hands-on experience in Java development and production support.</li><li>Strong knowledge of Java programming language and frameworks (e.g., Spring, Spring Boot, Microservices).</li><li>Proficiency in troubleshooting Java applications, identifying root causes, and implementing effective solutions.</li><li>Experience with application servers (e.g., Apache Tomcat, WebLogic), web servers (e.g., Apache HTTP Server), and databases (e.g., Oracle, MySQL). </li><li>Experience in cloud technology (Openshift / AWS). </li><li>Familiarity with Service Now (Incident Management, Problem Management and change management).</li><li>Familiarity with monitoring tools and technologies (e.g., Splunk, Dyantrace) to proactively identify and resolve issues.</li><li>Understanding of DevOps practices and tools (e.g., Jenkins, Git, Docker) for continuous integration and deployment.</li><li>Excellent problem-solving and analytical skills, with the ability to work under pressure in a fast-paced environment.</li><li>Strong communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to collaborate effectively with cross-functional teams.</li><li>Ability to prioritize and manage multiple tasks simultaneously while maintaining attention to detail. </li><li>Experience in scripting languages (e.g., Shell scripting, Python) is a plus.</li></ul><p><br></p>The Capgemini Freelancer Gateway is enabled by a cutting-edge software platform that leads the contingent labor world for technology innovation. The software platform leverages Machine Learning and Artificial Intelligence to make sure the right people end up in the right job.<p><br></p>A global leader in consulting, technology services and digital transformation, Capgemini is at the forefront of innovation to address the entire breadth of clients’ opportunities in the evolving world of cloud, digital and platforms. Building on its strong 50 year heritage and deep industry-specific expertise, Capgemini enables organizations to realize their business ambitions through an array of services from strategy to operations. Capgemini is driven by the conviction that the business value of technology comes from and through people. It is a multicultural company of over 200,000 team members in more than 40 countries. The Group reported 2018 global revenues of EUR 13.2 billion.<p><br></p>

title: Application Developer - Remote | WFH
description: <strong>Discover. A brighter future.</strong><p><br></p>With us, you’ll do meaningful work from Day 1. Our collaborative culture is built on three core behaviors: We Play to Win, We Get Better Every Day &amp; We Succeed Together. And we mean it — we want you to grow and make a difference at one of the world's leading digital banking and payments companies. We value what makes you unique so that you have an opportunity to shine.<p><br></p>Come build your future, while being the reason millions of people find a brighter financial future with Discover.<p><br></p><strong>Job Description:</strong><p><br></p>At Discover, be part of a culture where diversity, teamwork, and collaboration reign. Join a company that is just as employee focused as it is on its customers and is consistently awarded for both. <strong>We’re all about people, and our employees are why Discover <em>is </em>a great place to work. </strong>Be the reason we help millions of consumers build a brighter financial future and achieve yours along the way with a rewarding career.<p><br></p>As an Infrastructure Engineer (SharePoint Developer), you will be responsible for building, configuring, and customizing a modern Intranet solution utilizing modern SharePoint &amp; Microsoft Viva Connections. Additionally, you will own and build out the governance process for managing M365 integrations, MS graph API, power automate, and power applications. Responsibilities include building systems according to company specifications, building Microsoft Viva adaptive cards, writing, and modifying code, debugging software and training staff.<p><br></p>The ideal candidate will have the following skills: Modern SharePoint Design, Microsoft Graph API, UI/UX design process, proficient with .Net, JavaScript, C#, CSS &amp; HTML, Microsoft framework, and automation applications (power applications, power automate).<p><br></p><strong>Responsibilities</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Delivers technology solutions that support business goals. Partners with the product owner to understand business requirements, evaluates features, and translates application specifications into workable technical solutions.</li><li>Maintains application software and systems. Ensures all projects and releases are appropriately tested and risks are mitigated. </li><li>Oversees and reviews development activities of team members and contractors.</li><li>Supports technical initiatives and provides input best practices to team.</li><li>Achieves product commitments (and influences others to do the same) by using informal leadership &amp; highly developed communication skills and contributes to or led technology communities </li><li>Uses automation, system tools, open-source solutions, observability and 'security first' principles in daily work </li><li>Contributes to team agile ceremonies, leads demos and presentations, helps new engineers learn established norms </li><li>Initiates high level solution design approaches, and guides team to achieve desired key software delivery capabilities using automated, coded enterprise and observability </li><li>Participates in internal speaking and advocacy events </li><li>Supports research activities to adopt new technology solutions in ways of developing new capabilities </li><li>Continues professional education and creates opportunities for core product teams to learn engineering best practices </li><li>Coaches immediate chapter and actively fosters the adoption of new technologies </li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Minimum Qualifications</strong><p><br></p><strong>At a minimum, here’s what we need from you:</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Bachelors – Computer Science or related </li><li>3+ Years – (Software) Engineering, DevOps or related </li><li>Internal applicants only: technical proficiency rating of competent on the Dreyfus engineering scale </li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Preferred Qualifications</strong><p><br></p><strong>Bonus Points If You Have:</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>In depth knowledge with PowerShell scripting and automation builds</li><li>Familiar with Jira and Agile Scrum methods (ceremonies)</li><li>Actively fosters the adoption of new technologies</li><li>Continues professional education and create opportunities for core product teams to learn engineering best practices</li><li>Initiates high level solution design approaches, and guides team to achieve desired key software delivery capabilities using automated, coded enterprise and observability</li><li>Participates in internal speaking and advocacy event</li><li>Supports research activities to adopt new technology solutions in ways of developing new capabilities</li><li>Achieves product commitments (and influences others to do the same) by using informal leadership &amp; highly developed communication skills and contributes to or led technology communities</li></ul><p><br></p>External applicants will be required to perform a technical interview<p><br></p>#Remote<p><br></p>#BI-Remote<p><br></p><strong>Compensation:</strong><p><br></p>The base pay for this position generally ranges between $84,500.00 to $142,500.00. Additional incentives may be provided as part of a market competitive total compensation package. Factors, such as but not limited to, geographical location, relevant experience, education, and skill level may impact the pay for this position.<p><br></p><strong><strong><strong>Benefits:</strong></strong></strong><p><br></p>We also offer a range of benefits and programs based on eligibility. These benefits include:<p><br></p><ul><li>Paid Parental Leave</li><li>Paid Time Off</li><li>401(k) Plan</li><li>Medical, Dental, Vision, &amp; Health Savings Account</li><li>STD, Life, LTD and AD&amp;D</li><li>Recognition Program</li><li>Education Assistance</li><li>Commuter Benefits</li><li>Family Support Programs</li><li>Employee Stock Purchase Plan</li></ul><p><br></p>Learn more at MyDiscoverBenefits.com.<p><br></p>What are you waiting for? Apply today!<p><br></p>All Discover employees place our customers at the very center of our work. To deliver on our promises to our customers, each of us contribute every day to a culture that values compliance and risk management.<p><br></p>Discover is committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace. Discover is an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate on the basis of race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability, protected veteran status, or other legally protected status. (Know Your Rights)<p><br></p>

title: Infrastructure Engineer (multiple openings) - IHM
description: <strong>About The Role<br><br></strong>The Employee Productivity Tools team is seeking an ambitious self-starter for a position with the possibility of working virtually. The team member will be responsible for Atlassian Jira and Confluence administration. Experience in the ServiceNow space is also a plus. In this position this team member will be involved in development and configuration activities in the ITSM, HRSD, and ITOM workflows. The highly visible team member will work closely with all groups throughout the organization and must think “outside the box”. We practice Agile methodologies and move quickly to adapt.<br><br><strong>Job responsibilities: <br></strong><ul><li>Work with key stakeholders to enable and improve custom workflows, fields, screens, dashboards, and reports.</li><li>Support JIRA administration, including design, creation and management of custom workflows, custom fields, dashboards, addons, reports and integration with other development tools.</li><li>Work closely with the IT and internal Atlassian teams on projects such as major upgrades, data migrations, automations, plugin selection, and integration with other systems.</li><li>Ability to write advanced JQL (Jira Query Language) to create filters and boards for individuals and teams.</li><li>Maintaining customizations across versions and instances of JIRA.</li><li>Work with our development team to extend JIRA integration with other tools.</li><li>Perform regular sessions with internal teams to understand where JIRA processes can be improved and/or streamlined.</li><li>Write clear documentation materials for training purposes.</li><li>Creating and implementing complex pages</li><li>Creating and implementing custom widgets</li><li>Implementing designer-provided user interfaces</li><li>Matching the UI from designs on various pages of a portal</li><li>Resolving UI performance bottlenecks</li><li>Resolving complex widget defects</li><li>Writing ATF tests</li><li>Analyzing usage statistics</li><li>Ensuring custom widgets and pages are ready for upgrade<br><br></li></ul><strong>Qualifications: <br></strong><ul><li>Bachelor of Science in Computer Science, Engineering, or equivalent.</li><li>Three to five years of experience managing Atlassian JIRA and Confluence as an administrator is required.</li><li>Experience configuring projects, configuring complex JQL, condition-based workflows, and updating fields based on conditions.</li><li>Experience developing and maintaining Post Functions and ScriptRunner automation.</li><li>Experience in performing Atlassian installations, migrations, and plugin installation.</li><li>Experience developing application/scripts in Groovy.</li><li>Exceptional customer service, organization, interpersonal, time-management and written and verbal communication skills.</li><li>High degree of self-motivation.</li><li>The ability to adapt quickly to new tasks.</li><li>The ability to learn custom applications, support, and troubleshoot.</li><li>3+ years experience developing on the ServiceNow platform</li><li>2+ years experience developing custom service portals</li><li>Experience with integrations, platform configuration, design, and deployment</li><li>Experience with custom application development including Custom Service Portal widget creation</li><li>2+ years of scripting/coding Experience (e.g., JavaScript, AngularJS, HTML, Bootstrap, SQL)<br><br></li></ul><strong>Nice to have: <br></strong><ul><li>ServiceNow Certifications a plus (bonus for ServiceNow Portal Fundamentals, ServiceNow Portal Advanced)</li><li>Web development experience a plus</li><li>Knowledge of AWS services and Atlassian data center versions of Confluence and Jira are nice to have.<br><br></li></ul>001_MstarInc Morningstar Inc. Legal Entity<br><br>Morningstar’s hybrid work environment gives you the opportunity to work remotely and collaborate in-person each week. We’ve found that we’re at our best when we’re purposely together on a regular basis, at least three days each week. A range of other benefits are also available to enhance flexibility as needs change. No matter where you are, you’ll have tools and resources to engage meaningfully with your global colleagues.

The team member will be responsible for Atlassian Jira and Confluence administration. Experience in the ServiceNow space is also a plus. In this position this team member will be involved in development and configuration activities in the ITSM, HRSD, and ITOM workflows. The highly visible team member will work closely with all groups throughout the organization and must think “outside the box”. We practice Agile methodologies and move quickly to adapt.<br><br><strong>Job responsibilities: <br></strong><ul><li>Work with key stakeholders to enable and improve custom workflows, fields, screens, streamlined.</li><li>Write clear documentation materials for training purposes.</li><li>Creating and implementing complex pages</li><li>Creating and implementing custom widgets</li><li>Implementing designer-provided user interfaces</li><li>Matching the UI from designs on various pages of a portal</li><li>Resolving UI performance bottlenecks</li><li>Resolving complex widget title: Cloud Engineer
description: We're thrilled to present an incredible opportunity for a talented Front-End Web Developer to join a dynamic team working on an exciting project - the development of a cutting-edge website to showcase a brand new product line. This position offers a contract-to-permanent arrangement, combining the best of both worlds with a hybrid work schedule - three days onsite and two days remote. We're seeking local candidates based in or near the vibrant city of Chicago, IL.<br><br>At our company, we value self-starters who possess the ability to work autonomously while also thriving in a collaborative team environment. This role provides ample room for personal and professional growth, making it an ideal opportunity for ambitious individuals seeking to make their mark.<br><br><strong><u>Responsibilities<br><br></u></strong>Spearhead the development of an innovative website, starting from scratch.<br><br>Demonstrate a strong aptitude for both independent work and effective teamwork.<br><br><strong><u>Qualifications<br><br></u></strong>To be successful in the role of Front-End Web Developer, you should have:<br><br>A proven track record of 3-5+ years in designing, implementing, and maintaining websites.<br><br>Proficiency in developing a website from the ground up.<br><br>The ability to provide valuable insights and recommendations for the technology roadmap.<br><br>Expertise in HTML, CSS, PHP, JavaScript, and related technologies.<br><br>Familiarity with creating and modifying custom theme files and child themes.<br><br>Knowledge of server-side tasks such as MX Records and DNS maintenance.<br><br>If you are searching for the perfect blend of creativity, technical expertise, and professional growth, then look no further. Join our team as we revolutionize the industry and create a lasting impact.<br><br>Keywords: Front-End Web Developer, HTML, CSS, PHP, JavaScript, Websites, MX Records, DNS, Software Engineer, Software Developer, Programmer Analyst, Programming, Chicago Recruiters, Information Technology Jobs, IT Jobs, Chicago Recruiting<br><br>Whether you are based in Chicago, IL, or other cities across the country, our IT recruiting agencies and staffing companies are dedicated to helping you find your dream Front-End Web Developer position.<br><br>If you're ready to take the next step in your career and embark on an exciting journey, don't hesitate to reach out to our IT recruiting agencies and IT staffing companies today!<br><br>Employment Type: Full-Time<br><br>Salary: $ 59,000.00 98,000.00 Per Year

title: WordPress Developer
description: We’re building a relationship-oriented bank for the modern world. We need talented, passionate professionals who are dedicated to doing what’s right for our clients.<p><br></p>At CIBC, we embrace your strengths and your ambitions, so you are empowered at work. Our team members have what they need to make a meaningful impact and are truly valued for who they are and what they contribute.<p><br></p>To learn more about CIBC, please visit CIBC.com<p><br></p><strong>Job Description</strong><p><br></p>Community Development is responsible for managing the Bank’s Community Impact initiatives, providing financing to support community development in the communities we serve and cultivating relationships and partnerships with our local communities. CIBC Bank USA is committed to supporting causes that matter to our clients, our employees and our communities. We aim to make a difference in communities through specialized community development financing, corporate donations, sponsorships and the volunteer spirit of our employees.<p><br></p><strong>What you'll be doing:</strong><p><br></p>The Quality Assurance Analyst’s primary role will be to support the Community Development Group to ensure compliance with regulatory and CIBC reporting requirements and monitoring of the existing Community Development Group loan portfolio.<p><br></p><strong>Responsibilities include:</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Primarily responsible for ensuring the Community Development Group’s compliance with Regulation B on a daily basis. Complete required Regulation B reporting to CIBC’s Compliance team on a monthly basis.</li><li>Completion of the risk rating validation of the Community Development Group loan portfolio on a quarterly basis (including fiscal year end).</li><li>Completion of monthly reporting on non-performing, criticized and past due loans to CIBC’s Credit Risk Management team.</li><li>Review transactions closed on a monthly basis to document and report any credit exceptions to Community Development Group’s credit policy and procedures. Assist with the reporting of credit exceptions to the Small Business Exception Forum.</li><li>Completion of Notices of Default and Collection letters to Community Development Group customers that are past due on loan payments (including loan maturities).</li><li>Provide necessary loan documents to CIBC’s outside collection agency for transactions that are transferred to collections.</li><li>Complete necessary reporting on Community Development Group real estate transactions.</li><li>Provide supporting documentation to support ongoing Compliance monitoring as well as annual Compliance audits.</li><li>Complete the necessary reporting to Compliance associated with any formal complaints received from existing or prospective Community Development Group customers.</li><li>Assist with updates of business-specific processes and procedures, as applicable, in alignment with existing frameworks, policies, standards, and risk appetites.</li><li>Assist with the account management including the monitoring of past due payments received from of distressed portfolio accounts. </li><li>Work with Governance &amp; Controls teams (1Bs) or Internal Audit as needed to respond to Internal Audit reviews and findings.</li><li>Support procedural training (as applicable)</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Compliance Requirements/Responsibilities:</strong><p><br></p>Our CIBC risk culture is based on employees striving to exceed the expectations of ourselves and our leadership’s identification and mitigation of risks in their daily responsibilities, not just in quarterly or annual monitoring/assessments. We all are accountable for managing risk.<p><br></p>As an employee of CIBC the incumbent must conduct themselves (and foster an environment for others) in a manner consistent with our strong risk culture. This includes:<p><br></p><ul><li>Following all aspects of the CIBC Code of Conduct, as well as all applicable CIBC policies, frameworks, guidelines, processes and controls</li><li>At all times acting in accordance with our Purpose and shared values, to achieve our Bank’s strategic goals</li><li>Understanding and following the qualitative and quantitative components of our Risk Appetite Statements</li><li>Completing all annual Corporate Mandatory Training and Testing modules, as well as any additional business-specific modules, as required and employing the learnings in daily activities and undertakings</li><li>Escalating matters through one of the appropriate channels identified in the CIBC Code of Conduct (i.e., HR, management, Ethics Hotline, Whistleblower, etc.) upon observing activities that may be inconsistent with CIBC’s policies, frameworks, guidelines, processes and controls</li><li>Speaking up if witnessing behaviors that drive poor or unfair outcomes for clients, team members or other stakeholders</li><li>Escalating matters that can result in adverse market practices and outcomes, thereby negatively impacting CIBC’s reputation as a leading financial institution</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Knowledge and Skills:</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>College education and equivalent of 3+ years of job experience in financial services industry.</li><li>Proficiency in banking applications and Microsoft suite of products (Word, Excel, PowerPoint, etc.)</li><li>Possess creative problem-solving abilities</li><li>Strong interpersonal skills</li><li>Excellent verbal and written communication</li><li>Good organizational skills including attention to detail and follow through</li><li>Ability to work well under compressed time constraints</li><li>Ability to manage multiple tasks/projects at one time</li></ul><p><br></p>California residents — your privacy rights regarding your actual or prospective employment<p><br></p><strong>What you need to know:</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>CIBC is committed to creating an inclusive environment where all team members and clients feel like they belong. We seek applicants with a wide range of abilities and we provide an accessible candidate experience. If you need accommodation, please contact Mailbox.careers-carrieres@cibc.com</li><li>You need to be legally eligible to work at the location(s) specified above and, where applicable, must have a valid work or study permit.</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>What You Need To Know</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>CIBC is committed to creating an inclusive environment where all team members and clients feel like they belong. We seek applicants with a wide range of abilities and we provide an accessible candidate experience. If you need accommodation, please contact Mailbox.careers-carrieres@cibc.com</li><li>You need to be legally eligible to work at the location(s) specified above and, where applicable, must have a valid work or study permit.</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Job Location</strong><p><br></p>IL-120 S LaSalle St<p><br></p><strong>Employment Type</strong><p><br></p>Regular<p><br></p><strong>Weekly Hours</strong><p><br></p>40<p><br></p><strong>Skills</strong><p><br></p>Accounting, Business, Credit, Lending, Risk Management

title: Power Platform Developer
description: <strong>The role of a Telecommunications Field Engineer at Canonical</strong><p><br></p>The telco industry is moving to software-defined services. This transformation is driven by open source software, cloud computing and the move to VNF / CNF approaches. Canonical Ubuntu is a key platform for telco innovation, and we are growing our team of specialists who work in the industry to accelerate the change.<p><br></p>Canonical enables operators and communications service providers to embrace this new world, with a focus on platforms such as Ubuntu, OpenStack, and Kubernetes, and reusable, high quality automation for operations at scale.<p><br></p>As part of the Canonical Field Engineering organization, you will lead customers through the design and delivery of OpenStack, Kubernetes, and software-defined networking solutions. Your passion for open-source technologies will enable customers to understand and operate advanced infrastructure substrates to meet the demands of 5G and beyond.<p><br></p><strong>Location:</strong> Remote-based, Americas and EMEA<p><br></p><strong>What Your Day Will Look Like</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Match customer requirements to advanced capabilities in the VNF/CNF/NFVi/NFVO/VNFM/VIM/MEC space</li><li>Provide technical pre-sales consulting to Service Provider teams</li><li>Design and implement telco-grade open source multi-tenant private clouds and micro clouds</li><li>Investigate, report and/or fix software defects uncovered during customer deployments</li><li>Demonstrate advanced Infrastructure as code (IaC) techniques relevant to telco</li><li>Architect and implement advanced, resilient Service Provider Cloud and Application solutions</li><li>Design and deliver software defined infrastructure with OpenStack, Kubernetes, MAAS and Ceph</li><li>Learn model-driven operations with Juju charms for Kafka, Hadoop, PostgreSQL, MongoDB, NGINX, and more</li><li>Help customers adopt advanced Bare Metal, Public, Private and Hybrid Cloud solutions</li><li>Learn from customer engagements and drive meaningful product improvements</li><li>Shape our roadmap to accelerate our growth in the telco market</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>What We Are Looking For In You</strong><p><br></p><ul><li> Python software development experience</li><li>A thorough understanding of the telco NFVi (VIM), NFVO, VNFM and MEC space</li><li>Technical understanding of key telco technologies like CPU Pinning, NUMA, SRIOV, DPDK, etc</li><li> A thorough working understanding of the architectures and infrastructure of MNOs and CSPs</li><li>Working knowledge of Mobile Packet Core, Radio, VAS, OSS/BSS</li><li>Understanding of best practices for open source technology in telco virtualisation</li><li>Working knowledge of Linux, Openstack and Kubernetes networking</li><li>A passion to automate and improve all aspects of open source products and tooling</li><li>Ability to lead complex projects from start to finish</li><li>A collaborative attitude with a keen eye on customer success</li><li>Excellent communication and presentation abilities</li><li>Able to travel up to 50% of the time for events, customer meetings, project delivery</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Additional Skills That You Might Also Bring</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Second language such as Japanese, French, German, Spanish or Portuguese</li><li>Track record of open source contributions </li></ul><p><br></p><strong>What We Offer You</strong><p><br></p>Your base pay will depend on various factors including your geographical location, level of experience, knowledge and skills. In addition to the benefits above, certain roles are also eligible for additional benefits and rewards including annual bonuses and sales incentives based on revenue or utilisation. Our compensation philosophy is to ensure equity right across our global workforce.<p><br></p>In addition to a competitive base pay, we provide all team members with additional benefits, which reflect our values and ideals. Please note that additional benefits may apply depending on the work location and, for more information on these, you can ask in the later stages of the recruitment process.<p><br></p><ul><li>Fully remote working environment - we've been working remotely since 2004!</li><li>Personal learning and development budget of 2,000USD per annum</li><li>Annual compensation review</li><li>Recognition rewards</li><li>Annual holiday leave</li><li>Parental Leave</li><li>Employee Assistance Programme</li><li>Opportunity to travel to new locations to meet colleagues at 'sprints'</li><li>Priority Pass for travel and travel upgrades for long haul company events</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>About Canonical</strong><p><br></p>Canonical is a pioneering tech firm that is at the forefront of the global move to open source. As the company that publishes Ubuntu, one of the most important open source projects and the platform for AI, IoT and the cloud, we are changing the world on a daily basis. We recruit on a global basis<p><br></p>and set a very high standard for people joining the company. We expect excellence - in order to succeed, we need to be the best at what we do.<p><br></p>Canonical has been a remote-first company since its inception in 2004. Work at Canonical is a step into the future, and will challenge you to think differently, work smarter, learn new skills, and raise your game. Canonical provides a unique window into the world of 21st-century digital business.<p><br></p><strong>Canonical is an equal opportunity employer</strong><p><br></p>We are proud to foster a workplace free from discrimination. Diversity of experience, perspectives, and background create a better work environment and better products. Whatever your identity, we will give your application fair consideration.<p><br></p>

delivery</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Additional Skills That You Might Also Bring</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Second language such as Japanese, French, German, Spanish or Portuguese</li><li>Track record of open source contributions </li></ul><p><br></p><strong>What We Offer You</strong><p><br></p>Your base pay will depend on various factors including your geographical location, level of experience, knowledge and skills. In addition to the benefits above, certain roles are also eligible for additional benefits and rewards including annual bonuses and sales incentives based on revenue or utilisation. Our compensation philosophy is to ensure equity right across our global workforce.<p><br></p>In addition to a competitive base pay, we provide all team members with additional benefits, which reflect our values and ideals. Please note that additional benefits may apply depending on the work location and, for more information on these, you can ask in the later stages of the recruitment process.<p><br></p><ul><li>Fully remote working environment - we've been working remotely since 2004!</li><li>Personal learning and development budget of 2,000USD per annum</li><li>Annual compensation review</li><li>Recognition rewards</li><li>Annual holiday leave</li><li>Parental Leave</li><li>Employee Assistance Programme</li><li>Opportunity to travel to new locations to meet colleagues at 'sprints'</li><li>Priority Pass for travel and travel upgrades for long haul company events</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>About Canonical</strong><p><br></p>Canonical is a pioneering tech firm that is at the forefront of the global move to open source. As the company that publishes Ubuntu, one of the most important open source projects and the platform for AI, IoT and the cloud, we are changing the world on a daily basis. We recruit on a global basis<p><br></p>and set a very high standard for people joining the company. We expect excellence - in order to succeed, we need to be the best at what we do.<p><br></p>Canonical has been a remote-first company since its inception in 2004. Work at Canonical is a step into the future, and will challenge you to think differently, work smarter, learn new skills, and raise your game. Canonical provides a unique window into the world of 21st-century digital business.<p><br></p><strong>Canonical is an equal opportunity employer</strong><p><br></p>We are proud to foster a workplace free from discrimination. Diversity of experience, perspectives, and background create a better work environment and better products. Whatever your identity, we will give your application fair consideration.<p><br></p>

title: Java Production Support Engineer (contract)
description: Join an exciting and dynamic team at NORC at the University of Chicago, a reputable and unbiased research organization with over 75 years of expertise in data collection, program evaluation, data analysis, and information dissemination. We are currently seeking talented Financial Analysts to join our Financial Management and Analysis team. As a Financial Analyst, you will provide ongoing support for multiple projects, including project tracking, budget monitoring, forecasting and modeling, and pricing for proposals.<br><br>we value expertise in project accounting, project management, and experience in working with government contracts and grants. As an integral part of our team, you will collaborate with senior financial analysts and project teams while enjoying the opportunity to work both independently and in a supportive environment.<br><br>the company currently has openings in our Chicago office and an exciting opportunity for a candidate based in the Hyde Park office. The selected candidate will have the flexibility to work from NORC's Chicago Loop office on varying days throughout the week when office-based work resumes.<br><br>We offer flexible work arrangements, allowing employees to choose between remote, hybrid, or in-office work options.<br><br>Department: Financial Management and Analysis<br><br>company's Financial Management and Analysis department plays a crucial role in supporting NORC's mission of providing trustworthy data to decision-makers around the world. Our team ensures that NORC's financial management functions are fully aligned and integrated, working closely with research departments, as well as other administrative departments, to navigate the complex government regulatory environment.<br><br><strong><u>Responsibilities<br><br></u></strong>Review, approve, and track project expenses, including processing vendor invoices and monitoring spending against purchase orders.<br><br>Manage project billing, monitor project receivables, and address client budget and billing inquiries as necessary.<br><br>Contribute to periodic client financial reports as required by projects.<br><br>Assist Senior Financial Analysts with cost estimation for project budget modifications or cost over/underrun scenarios.<br><br>Review and provide quality assurance for client and vendor invoices, expense reports, cost reports, purchase requisitions, and other project-related expenses to ensure compliance with accounting standards and regulations.<br><br>Close out project accounts upon completion.<br><br>Support Senior Financial Analysts in revenue and cost-estimating efforts for proposals.<br><br>Perform other duties as assigned.<br><br><strong><u>Required Skills<br><br></u></strong>Bachelor's Degree in finance, accounting, economics, or a related area is required.<br><br>Minimum of 6 months of experience in project-based account management is highly desired.<br><br>Strong interpersonal and communication skills.<br><br>Proficiency in budget development, forecasting, and analysis.<br><br>Ability to manage multiple tasks under time pressure while maintaining accuracy and attention to detail.<br><br>Ability to work with minimal supervision.<br><br>Familiarity with federal government accounting regulations and accounting and contractual structures (i.e., FAR, OMB, FTR) is preferred.<br><br>Experience in Microsoft Office Suite; intermediate to advanced knowledge of Excel is preferred.<br><br>Skills in the use of Enterprise Resource Planning (ERP) software. Costpoint and FocusPoint experience is a plus.<br><br><strong><u>What We Do<br><br></u></strong>NORC at the University of Chicago is an objective, non-partisan research institution that delivers reliable data and rigorous analysis to guide critical programmatic, business, and policy decisions. With a rich history dating back to 1941, our teams have conducted groundbreaking studies, applied innovative methods and tools, and upheld principles of scientific integrity and collaboration. Today, clients from government, corporate, and nonprofit sectors around the world partner with us to transform complex information into actionable knowledge.<br><br><strong><u>Who We Are<br><br></u></strong>For over 75 years, NORC has been at the forefront of research innovation, constantly pushing boundaries in research methods, technical applications, and groundbreaking findings. While we take pride in our stellar research and analysis work, we also foster a supportive and collaborative environment where relationships flourish. With world-class benefits, a business casual environment, and a commitment to continuous learning, NORC offers a place where your work can make a global impact and where you can build lasting connections with colleagues.<br><br><strong><u>Equal Employment Opportunity Statement<br><br></u></strong>NORC is an affirmative action, equal opportunity employer that values and actively seeks diversity in the workforce. We evaluate qualified applicants without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, disability, veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity, and other legally protected characteristics.<br><br>Employment Type: Full-Time<br><br>Salary: $ 50,000.00 Per Year

title: Employee Technology Systems Engineer
description: We're on the lookout for an enthusiastic and talented IT Web/Mobile Application Developer to join our dynamic team! If you're passionate about crafting innovative web and mobile applications, this is the perfect opportunity for you. As our developer, you'll have the chance to collaborate across various business functions, creating high-performing applications that are both scalable and user-friendly. Get ready to showcase your technical expertise as you tackle challenges, troubleshoot issues, and make a real impact by saving the day for our users!<br><br>At our company, we embrace the New Ways of Work, allowing you to work remotely from anywhere in the United States (except Hawaii or United States Territories). With this flexibility, you'll enjoy a perfect work-life balance. While most of your work will be remote, occasional travel of up to 20% may be required, including a week-long stay in Rosemont, IL, each month (Monday morning to Friday afternoon). Additionally, you may need to make infrequent visits to divisions and attend vendor seminars.<br><br>What we're looking for in our ideal Web/Mobile Application Developer:<br><br>Proficiency in Angular, React, Rest API, Node, and AWS is a must. Show us what you've got!<br><br><strong><u>Your Responsibilities Will Include<br><br></u></strong>Actively participating in project ideation, from concept to delivery<br><br>Gathering information from existing systems and analyzing program and time requirements<br><br>Creating detailed specifications for program development and coding<br><br>Developing moderately complex programs that meet technical standards and specifications<br><br>Designing and implementing effective test plans to verify program logic<br><br>Documenting your work assignments, including program code and technical documentation<br><br>Assisting support and project personnel in resolving program-related issues<br><br><strong><u>To Qualify For This Role, You Should Have<br><br></u></strong>A B.S. degree in Computer Science, Engineering, Information Systems, or a related field (required)<br><br><strong><u>Experience In Requirements Gathering, Design, Implementation, Integration, And Testing<br><br></u></strong>Coursework or demonstrated skill in object-oriented programming<br><br>Previous experience in web application development or hands-on website development<br><br>The ability to seamlessly integrate front-end templates with back-end functionality<br><br>Excellent written and verbal communication skills<br><br>Strong organizational and multitasking abilities<br><br><strong><u>Preferred Skills<br><br></u></strong>Knowledge of microservice architecture<br><br>Proficiency in JDBC, JMS, Web Services, J2EE, Applet, Servlet, JSP, JSON<br><br>Experience with HTML5, CSS3, Angular, JavaScript/jQuery<br><br>Familiarity with WebLogic, Tomcat<br><br>Exposure to Docker, Kubernetes, Kafka, and Swagger<br><br>Experience with AWS services such as API Gateway, WebSocket, Lambda, EC2, S3<br><br>Familiarity with New Relic and Git<br><br>We strive to provide competitive compensation based on experience, geographic location, and other factors permitted by law, in accordance with state and local regulations.<br><br>Join our team and be part of an exciting journey in the world of web and mobile application development! Apply today and let your skills shine in our collaborative and innovative environment.<br><br>Employment Type: Full-Time<br><br>Salary: $ 64,000.00 86,000.00 Per Year

title: Front-End Web Developer - Remote | WFH
description: We have an incredible opportunity for a Front-End Web Developer to join a dynamic team in developing a cutting-edge website to promote an exciting new product line. This position offers a contract-to-permanent arrangement and allows for a flexible work environment, with a hybrid schedule of three days on-site and two days remote. We are seeking candidates who are local or near Chicago, IL.<br><br>At our company, we value self-starters who thrive both independently and in a collaborative team setting. This role presents significant growth potential for the right individual.<br><br><strong><u>Responsibilities<br><br></u></strong>Lead the development of a brand-new website from inception to completion.<br><br>Demonstrate expertise in working both independently and collaboratively.<br><br>Contribute to the technology roadmap by providing valuable recommendations.<br><br><strong><u>Qualifications<br><br></u></strong>As a Front-End Web Developer, you should possess the following qualifications:<br><br>3-5+ years of experience in designing, implementing, and maintaining websites.<br><br>Proficiency in developing websites from scratch.<br><br>Ability to provide recommendations for the technology roadmap.<br><br>Strong command of HTML, CSS, PHP, JavaScript, and other relevant technologies.<br><br>Experience creating and modifying custom theme files and child themes.<br><br>Knowledge of server-side tasks, including MX Records and DNS maintenance.<br><br>Join us in the vibrant city of Chicago, where you'll have the opportunity to make a significant impact. We are searching for passionate Front-End Web Developers to take part in our innovative projects. Apply today and take the first step towards an exciting career!<br><br>Employment Type: Full-Time<br><br>Salary: $ 68,000.00 186,000.00 Per Year

title: Quality Assurance Analyst
description: Description <br><br>We are looking for a Sr. Security DevOps to join the Cloud Security organization. They will be supporting our mission of providing secure, reliable and innovative payment solutions to our healthcare clients. The Sr. DevOps Engineer works to deliver high-quality cloud solutions and helps drive a strong DevOps culture. As part of the Cloud Security Operations team, you will be responsible for the architecture, development, deployment, and operations of our cloud infrastructure. You will be expected to share the on-call duty with the rest of the Cloud Security Operations and engineering teams. Working closely with our Development teams you will be a champion of DevOps best practices including CI/CD, Infrastructure as code, containerization, microservice architecture, automated testing, and security.<br><br> Primary Responsibilities <br><ul><li> Collaborate with Developers to build a world-class infrastructure that can meet our customer’s security and uptime requirements</li><li> Act as a key contributor to the development of our developer and CI/CD processes to improve our developer agility and code quality</li><li> Manage mission-critical cloud-based production systems; proactively take action if/when systems are down or there are interruptions in service; root cause and implement corrective actions to build long-term customer loyalty</li><li> Help create and evolve our operational processes</li><li> Help to identify emerging technologies that can enhance our offering to our customers</li><li> Be passionate about automation, quality, reliability, and scalability<br><br></li></ul> Required Skills <br><ul><li> Minimum 3+ years in Cloud Technologies preferably AWS</li><li> Minimum 3+ years of experience with deployment orchestration systems such as Kubernetes, ECS, and Elastic Beanstalk</li><li> Minimum 2+ years of experience working with CI/CD tools such as CircleCI or Jenkins</li><li> Minimum 2+ years of experience with Docker and Docker-Compose</li><li> Minimum 4+ years with configuration management and automation tools (e.g., Puppet, Ansible, Chef, CloudFormation, SaltStack, Terraform)</li><li> Strong Linux system administration experience</li><li> Strong programming experience in at least one language (python, node, java, go, c/c++, ruby)</li><li> Experience with logging and monitoring tools such as ELK, DataDog or NewRelic, LogEntries, SumoLogic, etc.</li><li> Experience with Incident Management and crisis management</li><li> Able to participate in 24/7 on-call rotation</li><li> Strong written and verbal communication skills<br><br></li></ul> Desired Skills <br><ul><li> Experience managing an off-shore engineering team.</li><li> Expertise in Agile methods, software development lifecycle management, continuous integration, and build and release management.</li><li> HIPPA and PCI experience</li><li> BS/MS degree in Computer Science or a related field, or equivalent work experience<br><br></li></ul> Skills <br><br>Devops, Aws, Jenkins, Kubernetes, terraform, ci/cd, Continuous integration, Automation, migration, integration, security<br><br> Top Skills Details <br><br>Devops,Aws,Jenkins,Kubernetes,terraform,ci/cd,Continuous integration,Automation,migration,integration,security<br><br> Additional Skills &amp; Qualifications <br><ul><li> Knowledge of AWS and its associated technologies, both from Security and Cloud Ops perspective</li><li> Knowledge of Terraform</li><li> Experience taking vulnerabilities that are generated from 3rd Party scanning, do the analysis, determine remediation and implement remediation on lower environments. Validate fix, follow process to get that on to Production.</li><li> Perform Patch management tasks include: maintaining current knowledge of available patches, deciding what patches are appropriate for particular systems, ensuring that patches are installed properly, testing systems after installation, and documenting all associated procedures.</li><li> Maintain smooth operation of multi-user computer systems, including coordination with network, software, and system engineers, PC desktop technicians, project managers, end users, and customer and IT management.</li><li> Recommend and implement system enhancements that will improve the performance and reliability of the system including installing, upgrading/patching, monitoring, problem resolution, and configuration management.</li><li> Provide backup and recovery services; manage file systems and disk space; manage virus protection on a routine basis.</li><li> Create and maintain user and computer accounts and modify file permissions and security access lists.</li><li> Test new releases of products to ensure compatibility and minimize user impact.</li><li> Develop and document technical processes and procedures as needed. Provide technical assistance and support for incoming queries and issues related to computer systems, software, and hardware.</li><li> Administer servers, desktop computers, printers, routers, switches, firewalls, phones, smartphones, software deployment, security updates, and patches.</li><li> Assign configuration of authentication<br><br></li></ul> Experience Level <br><br>Expert Level<br><br> About TEKsystems <br><br>We're partners in transformation. We help clients activate ideas and solutions to take advantage of a new world of opportunity. We are a team of 80,000 strong, working with over 6,000 clients, including 80% of the Fortune 500, across North America, Europe and Asia. As an industry leader in Full-Stack Technology Services, Talent Services, and real-world application, we work with progressive leaders to drive change. That's the power of true partnership. TEKsystems is an Allegis Group company.<br><br>The company is an equal opportunity employer and will consider all applications without regards to race, sex, age, color, religion, national origin, veteran status, disability, sexual orientation, gender identity, genetic information or any characteristic protected by law.

verbal communication skills<br><br></li></ul> Desired Skills <br><ul><li> Experience managing an off-shore engineering team.</li><li> Expertise in Agile methods, software development lifecycle management, continuous integration, and build and release management.</li><li> HIPPA and PCI experience</li><li> BS/MS degree in Computer Science or a related field, or equivalent work experience<br><br></li></ul> Skills <br><br>Devops, Aws, Jenkins, Kubernetes, terraform, ci/cd, Continuous integration, Automation, migration, integration, security<br><br> Top Skills Details <br><br>Devops,Aws,Jenkins,Kubernetes,terraform,ci/cd,Continuous integration,Automation,migration,integration,security<br><br> Additional Skills &amp; Qualifications <br><ul><li> Knowledge of AWS and its associated technologies, both from Security and Cloud Ops perspective</li><li> Knowledge of Terraform</li><li> Experience taking vulnerabilities that are generated from 3rd Party scanning, do the analysis, determine remediation and implement remediation on lower environments. Validate fix, follow process to get that on to Production.</li><li> Perform Patch management tasks include: maintaining current knowledge of available patches, deciding what patches are appropriate for particular systems, ensuring that patches are installed properly, testing systems after installation, and documenting all associated procedures.</li><li> Maintain smooth operation of multi-user computer systems, including coordination with network, software, and system engineers, PC desktop technicians, project managers, end users, and customer and IT management.</li><li> Recommend and implement system enhancements that will improve the performance and reliability of the system including installing, upgrading/patching, monitoring, problem resolution, and configuration management.</li><li> Provide backup and recovery services; manage file systems and disk space; manage virus protection on a routine basis.</li><li> Create and maintain user and computer accounts and modify file permissions and security access lists.</li><li> Test new releases of products to ensure compatibility and minimize user impact.</li><li> Develop and document technical processes and procedures as needed. Provide technical assistance and support for incoming queries and issues related to computer systems, software, and hardware.</li><li> Administer servers, desktop computers, printers, routers, switches, firewalls, phones, smartphones, software deployment, security updates, and patches.</li><li> Assign configuration of authentication<br><br></li></ul> Experience Level <br><br>Expert Level<br><br> About TEKsystems <br><br>We're partners in transformation. We help clients activate ideas and solutions to take advantage of a new world of opportunity. We are a team of 80,000 strong, working with over 6,000 clients, including 80% of the Fortune 500, across North America, Europe and Asia. As an industry leader in Full-Stack Technology Services, Talent Services, and real-world application, we work with progressive leaders to drive change. That's the power of true partnership. TEKsystems is an Allegis Group company.<br><br>The company is an equal opportunity employer and will consider all applications without regards to race, sex, age, color, religion, national origin, veteran status, disability, sexual orientation, gender identity, genetic information or any characteristic protected by law.

title: Telco Cloud Field Engineer
description: <strong>Innovate here. And see your ideas come to life.<br><br></strong>It's an exciting time to work in tech at Edward Jones. We are making massive investments in emerging technologies to improve how we work with our clients and with each other. Relationships are the focus of our business model. And working in Technology here means using your skills to build, deliver and maintain the technologies that enable us to deepen and support those relationships. The best part? We develop and create our own industry-leading solutions internally. And you can be a part of it. Working with emerging new technologies. Creating platforms, programs and experiences that change how we work together - and support our client-first focus. Changing the future of our firm, the industry and the advisor-client relationship.<br><br><strong><u>Job Overview<br><br></u></strong>Position Schedule: Full-Time<br><br>In 2022, Edward Jones invested $1 billion in technology infrastructure, digital initiatives, and virtual business enablement tools. We're currently in the test and learn phase and are looking for talented, motivated professionals, that want to be part of this transformational journey. Cloud-based architecture and modern technical capabilities will enable us to grow our impact while providing the best client experience possible<br><br>You may be surprised to know that Edward Jones employs thousands of technical resources - all focused on creating world-class experiences for our clients and branch offices. If you've considered Edward Jones in the past, it's time to take another look. We are in the midst of embracing a modern, cloud-based architecture and are looking for exceptional individuals that want to be a part of that future.<br><br>We've invested millions of dollars into new technology platforms to help improve what matters most in our industry, client experience. We're currently implementing a modern, cloud based architecture and are looking for talented, and motived professionals that want to be part of providing the best client experience and financial resources possible.<br><br><strong><u>What You'll Do<br><br></u></strong>As a Platform Engineer, you will be a part of a diverse and collaborative team whose end goal is to focus on the firm's Enterprise Architecture in order to enable rapid system integrations with a steady focus on automation of processes. Together, we will focus on the collaboration with a diverse array of stakeholders from each area of the Technology division for continuous improvement.<br><br><strong><u>You Could Work On Any Of The Following Areas<br><br></u></strong>We are hoping that you will want to be apart an exception challenge and opportunity for someone who is equally as excited as we are for rapid change and continuous learning.<br><ul><li>Work closely with all members within Enterprise Architecture to ensure all systems and integrations are maintained with proper documentation. </li><li>Serve as a subject matter expert while leading all integrations with the Enterprise Architecture tool.</li><li>Collaborate with Architects and Leaders within Technology to provide guidance and leadership on data management best practices within the tool.</li><li>Document processes and procedures for internal and end-user consumption.</li><li>Exemplify excellent communication and interpersonal skills to communicate complex technical concepts to non-technical stakeholders.</li><li>Perform root cause analysis to be able to evaluate how systems fit together and how data flows from one system to another.</li><li>Spearhead and drive innovation through the exploration and implementation of new technologies and methodologies. </li><li>Serve as an informal leader with exceptional project management skills to drive cross functional teams to meet goals while maintaining governance standards. <br></li></ul><strong><u>Skills<br><br></u></strong>The salary range for this role is based on national data and actual pay is based on skills, experience, education, and other relevant factors for a potential new associate<br><br>At Edward Jones, we value and respect our associates and their contributions, and we recognize individual efforts through a rewards program that promotes a long-term career, financial security and well-being. Visit our career site to learn more about our total compensation approach, which in addition to base salary, typically includes benefits, bonuses and profit sharing.<br><br>Hiring Minimum: $92984<br><br>Hiring Maximum: $158325<br><br><strong><u>Skills/Requirements<br><br></u></strong><strong>What You'll Need:<br></strong><ul><li>5+ years of experience in IT operations, enterprise architecture, and/or related field.</li><li>5+ years of experience developing/customizing and monitoring tools and utilities. </li><li>Hands on experience building and integrating APIs. </li><li>Experience implementing and administering/managing technical solutions in major, large-scale system implementations. <br></li></ul><strong><u>What Could Set You Apart<br></u></strong><ul><li>Experience with Python, GitHub, Azure, and development skills</li><li>Experience with LeanIX or other EA tools<br></li></ul><strong>Awards &amp; Accolades</strong><ul><li>100 Best Workplaces for Millennials in 2022, published Fortune July 2022, Great Places to Work® data as of March 2022. Compensation provided for using, not obtaining, the rating.</li><ul><li> Edward Jones was recognized as one of the Best Workplaces for Millennials by Great Places to Work® and Fortune® magazine. The privately held firm ranked No. 2 overall, in its fourth appearance on the list.</li></ul><li>2022 Fortune Best Workplaces for Women, published September 2022, research by Great Places to Work®, data as of August 2021. Compensation provided for using, not obtaining, the rating.</li><ul><li>Edward Jones has been named to the 2022 Best Workplaces for Women list by Great Places to Work® and Fortune® magazine, ranking No. 45.</li></ul><li>2022 Fortune's 100 Best Companies to Work For, published April 2022, research by Great Place to Work®, data as of August 2021. Compensation provided for using, not obtaining, the rating.</li><ul><li>For the 23rd time, Edward Jones has earned a spot on the Fortune 100 Best Companies to Work For® ranking by Great Places to Work® and Fortune® magazine. Edward Jones ranked No. 35 on the prestigious 2022 list.</li><li>2022 Best Places to Work For LGBTQ+ Equality, Great Place to Work® in partnership with Human Rights Campaign Foundation, published Equity Magazine January 2022, data as of July 2021. Compensation provided for using, not obtaining, the rating.</li><ul><li> Edward Jones scored 100 percent on the Human Rights Campaign Foundation's 2022 Corporate Equality Index (CEI) the nation's foremost benchmarking survey and report measuring corporate policies and practices related to LGBTQ+ workplace equality. The ranking designated Jones as one of the best places to work for LGBTQ+Equality.<br></li></ul></ul></ul><strong><u>About Us<br><br></u></strong>At Edward Jones, we help clients achieve their serious, long-term financial goals by understanding their needs and implementing tailored solutions. To ensure a personal client experience, we have located our 15,000+ branch offices where our more than 7 million clients live and work.<br><br>In a typical branch office, a financial advisor meets with clients and receives branch office support, so they can focus on building deep relationships with clients. Headquarters associates in St. Louis, Tempe and Mississauga provide support and expertise to help U.S. and Canada branch teams deliver an ideal client experience. We continue to grow to meet the needs of long-term individual investors.<br><br>Edward Jones does not discriminate on the basis of race, color, gender, religion, national origin, age, disability, sexual orientation, pregnancy, veteran status, genetic information or any other basis prohibited by applicable law.<br><br>

title: Financial Analyst I in Chicago, Illinois - Remote | WFH
description: <strong>Duration</strong>: 5 months<p><br></p><strong><u>Job Description</u></strong><p><br></p>Primary Skill:<p><br></p><ul><li>Java 8, Spring Boot, Restful Microservices, React</li><li>Excellent communication skills</li><li>6+ years of software development experience in Java EE using RESTful web services</li><li>4+ years of front-end development using React.js</li><li>Exposure to Java frameworks, such as Spring</li><li>Experience with HTML5, CSS3, JavaScript, and AJAX</li><li>Experience with web and application servers, such as Apache, Tomcat.</li><li>Strong understanding of relational databases, especially MySQL and SQL queries</li><li>Demonstrated ability to work in both a team environment as well as individually</li><li>Strong background with testing strategies both manual and automated</li><li>Experience with source control systems specifically Git</li><li>Excellent analytic troubleshooting capabilities and problem solving skills</li><li>Ability to manage multiple priorities and projects simultaneously</li><li>Understanding of Agile methodologies A positive attitude always looking to empower the success of others</li><li>Willingness to take ownership and find ways to unblock oneself Trustworthy, team-oriented, and transparent</li></ul><p><br></p>The Capgemini Freelancer Gateway is enabled by a cutting-edge software platform that leads the contingent labor world for technology innovation. The software platform leverages Machine Learning and Artificial Intelligence to make sure the right people end up in the right job.<p><br></p>A global leader in consulting, technology services and digital transformation, Capgemini is at the forefront of innovation to address the entire breadth of clients’ opportunities in the evolving world of cloud, digital and platforms. Building on its strong 50 year heritage and deep industry-specific expertise, Capgemini enables organizations to realize their business ambitions through an array of services from strategy to operations. Capgemini is driven by the conviction that the business value of technology comes from and through people. It is a multicultural company of over 200,000 team members in more than 40 countries. The Group reported 2018 global revenues of EUR 13.2 billion.<p><br></p>

title: DevOps Engineer
description: Our client is a Dynamics NAV end user in the food manufacturing sector who is looking for a seasoned ERP Developer to lead customization and integration efforts on a series of upcoming technical projects. This is an amazing opportunity to join a well-established manufacturing firm with an exciting pipeline of future upgrade projects focused around their NAV system as well as a future implementation of D365 Business Central.<p><br></p>Your New Role<p><br></p><ul><li> Leading development efforts on the organization's NAV ERP system</li><li> Modifying the C/AL code in order to create greater technical efficiency</li><li> Designing the technical blue print for future upgrades</li><li> Working with users to define system requirements and identify paths for improvement</li><li> Collaborate with internal and external ERP teams on project delivery</li></ul><p><br></p>What You'll Need:<p><br></p><ul><li> 4+ years of experience with Dynamics NAV</li><li> C/AL &amp; C/SIDE programming experience</li><li> Experience with D365 Business Central, AL programming a plus</li><li> Expertise with the NAV finance, production, and warehousing modules</li><li> Advanced knowledge of SQL</li><li> NAV implementation experience preferred</li><li> Excellent communication and problem-solving ability</li></ul><p><br></p>Salary / Benefits<p><br></p><ul><li> Up to $120k base salary</li><li> Bonus potential</li><li> Competitive benefits package including medical, life insurance, and 401 (k) with company match</li><li> Excellent Paid Time Off Plan</li><li> Low Travel</li><li> Company cell phone</li><li> Remote access</li></ul><p><br></p>Apply now by sending your resume to m.potenza@nigelfrank.com or call Matt at 646-540-7521 to for more information.<p><br></p>Nigel Frank International is the global leader for Microsoft Dynamics recruitment, advertising more Dynamics NAV jobs than any other agency. We deal with both Microsoft Partners &amp; End Users throughout North America. By specializing solely in placing candidates in the Microsoft Dynamics market I have built relationships with most of the key employers in North America and have an unrivaled understanding of where the best opportunities and Dynamics NAV jobs are.<p><br></p>I understand the need for discretion and would welcome the opportunity to speak to any Microsoft Dynamics NAV candidates that are considering a new career or job either now or in the future. Confidentiality is of course guaranteed. For information on the Microsoft Dynamics market and some of the opportunities and Dynamics NAV jobs that are available I can be contacted on 646-540-7521. Please see www.nigelfrank.com for more fantastic Microsoft Dynamics opportunities!<p><br></p>Nigel Frank International Inc. is acting as an Employment Agency in relation to this vacancy

title: Linux Engineer / Middleware on W2 (Chicago, IL)
description: <strong>Are you searching for a rewarding experience helping children and families reach their goals and full potential? If you are passionate about improving the lives of children and adolescents on the autism spectrum, Key Autism is hiring motivated and passionate professionals, both experienced and entry level to join our growing team! We provide an in-depth ABA training to assist with growth and knowledge of the field and providing impeccable services to our families.<br><br></strong><strong>The hourly pay rate starts at $20/hour and onwards based on experience in the field, plus the opportunity to earn up to $4000.00 in incentive bonuses per year.<br><br></strong><strong>We have cases available in the Thornton, CO area.<br><br></strong>Key provides services for children on the autism spectrum directly under the guidance and supervision of a BCBA (Board Certified Behavior Analyst). This position is working in-home implementing ABA (applied behavior analysis) therapy and counselling programs established by a BCBA.<br><br>Depending on your location, most of the cases are after school hours, so you must have a flexible schedule for morning, afternoon, and evening shifts.<br><br><strong><u>Behavior Therapist Job Responsibilities<br></u></strong><ul><li>Provide one on one (1:1) in-home Applied Behavioral Analysis (ABA) therapy</li><li>Collect behavior and skill acquisition data during sessions</li><li>Conduct discrete trials, implement behavior support, and treatment plans</li><li>Work collaboratively with a BCBA (Board Certified Behavior Analyst) Supervisor to implement basic principles and teaching procedures of ABA therapy</li><li>Be responsive to the needs and requests of clients, their families and supervisors</li><li>Be goal-oriented and maintain professionalism in all aspects of your work</li><li>Arrive on time and be prepared for therapy sessions<br></li></ul><strong><u>Growth Opportunities In The Field Of ABA<br></u></strong><ul><li>Flexible Schedules</li><li>Competitive hourly rates, incentive programs, and bonuses</li><li>Behavior Therapist New-Hire Skills Training</li><li>For aspiring BCBA's we are offering University Partnerships, Supervision, Practicum, and Mentoring!</li><li>Tuition discount with our Partners!</li><li>Experience using a Cognitive Behavior Intervention Plan with youth and families</li><li>Registered Behavior Technician (RBT) Certification Assistance<br></li></ul><strong><u>Requirements<br></u></strong><ul><li>High School diploma or GED</li><li>Experience working with children for 1 year in a 1:1 setting</li><li>1-year ABA Experience</li><li>If no direct ABA experience, 1-2 years working as a Special Education Assistant, Paraprofessional, Direct Support Professional, Medical Assistant, Autism Experience, Teacher's Assistant, or ABA Tutor in a school or home setting</li><li>Ability to demonstrate excellent written and verbal communication skills</li><li>Personal means of transportation with a reliable vehicle</li><li>Maintain a valid driver's license and clean driving record</li><li>Must have your own transportation and auto insurance in order to travel between clients<br></li></ul><strong><u>Behavior Technician Physical Requirements<br></u></strong><ul><li>Employee must be able to lift up to 35lbs.</li><li>Required to perform activities that entail fine and gross motor skills, bend, kneel, squat, sitting on floor level or in a chair, or standing for periods of time.</li><li>Ability to respond quickly in short distances (100 feet) in response to the movements and behaviors of children. </li><li>Willingness and ability to work in both indoor and outdoor settings.<br></li></ul><strong><u>About Us<br><br></u></strong>Key Autism provides services to children and adults throughout the states of Massachusetts, Georgia, North Carolina, Florida, Colorado, Illinois, and Texas. Services include programs for children with Autism Spectrum Disorder and other related conditions. We have been serving families since 2014. At Key we work as compassionate partners with individuals, families, case managers and other professionals to provide the level of support needed to improve the lives of the clients we serve.<br><br>At Key Autism Services, all the autism treatment services we provide are guided by a common philosophy about the role of the family in a child's development. We strive to equip both the children and their families with necessary skills for strong, satisfying relationships with one another, because we know that learning happens best when it happens in the context of playful, reciprocal interactions with life partners.<br><br>We believe family is the foundation for a child's development. Family is the ever-present guiding force in a child's life from the first breath through all the growing-up years. Family doesn't close for the holidays, go on vacation or call it quits at five o'clock. Family remains a persistent presence on a day-in, day-out basis, through all the seasons of the year, through all the years of childhood.<br><br>Our team is committed to helping individuals and their families become self-sufficient and live as independently as their abilities allow. We hire compassionate, highly trained and dedicated individuals who show a passion to contribute their skills to make our client healthier and stronger.<br><br><strong><em>Check out more opportunities we have to offer! </em></strong>https://www.keyautismservices.com/careers/

If you are passionate about improving the lives of children and adolescents on the autism spectrum, Key Autism is hiring motivated and passionate professionals, both experienced and entry level to join our growing team! We provide an in-depth ABA training to assist with growth and knowledge of the field and providing impeccable services to our families.<br><br></strong><strong>The hourly pay rate starts at $20/hour and onwards based on experience in the field, plus the opportunity to earn up to $4000.00 in incentive bonuses per year.<br><br></strong><strong>We have cases available in the Thornton, CO area.<br><br></strong>Key provides services for children on the autism spectrum directly under the guidance and supervision of a BCBA (Board Certified Behavior Analyst). This position is working in-home implementing ABA (applied behavior analysis) therapy and counselling programs established by a BCBA.<br><br>Depending on your location, most of the cases are after (1:1) in-home Applied Behavioral Analysis (ABA) therapy</li><li>Collect behavior and skill acquisition data during sessions</li><li>Conduct discrete trials, implement behavior support, and treatment plans</li><li>Work collaboratively with a BCBA (Board Certified Behavior Analyst) Supervisor to implement basic principles and teaching procedures of ABA therapy</li><li>Be responsive to the needs and
