title: IT Web / Mobile Application Develope - Remote | WFH
description: Are you a Front End Developer with 5+ years of software development experience? Our client is seeking a full-time Front-end Developer to help build and maintain a multi-channel design system for a suite of financial products, and report to the Director of User Experience. <strong>This is a hybrid role in Chicago, Winter Park FL, West Des Moines IA, or Kansas City MO, and you must be able to work onsite 2-3 days a week.<br><br></strong><strong>You Will:<br></strong><ul><li>Build reusable configurable components for use across multiple products</li><li>Collaborate with development teams to promote standardization and reuse to achieve efficiency and a consistent user experience</li><li>Work side-by-side with the product design team to define a library of optimized components</li><li>Collaborate with product designers on UI design, guidelines and governance</li><li>Obtain component contributions from development teams, review code, and provide to the enterprise for reuse</li><li>Evangelize the utility of the design system and encourage adoption and participation from development teams</li><li>Advise development teams touching the front-end on implementation</li><li>Work as an independent developer willing to wear multiple hats</li><li>Establish good working relationships with teams around the globe</li><li>In addition to the maintenance, expansion, and ownership of the design system, over time there will be opportunities to work with individual product teams<br><br></li></ul><strong>You Have:<br></strong><ul><li>5+ years of software development experience</li><li>4+ years of experience with any of the following: React, Angular, CSS/SASS/Less, Storybook, npm, and working knowledge of multiple front-end frameworks. Proven experience successfully building out Storybook.js or similar framework</li><li>Experience with multi-channel design systems</li><li>Proficiency with JavaScript (ES6) or TypeScript</li><li>Experience with responsive web design and the ability to deliver across devices and platforms</li><li>Working knowledge of digital product design and user experience</li><li>Ability to work independently and collaborate and advise with multiple teams</li><li>Strong communication skills and attention to detail</li><li>Bonus points for knowledge of financial industry or financial software experience</li><li>Bonus points for experience working in a regulated corporate environment<br><br></li></ul><strong>Preferred:<br></strong><ul><li>Knowledge of financial markets or a strong desire to learn</li><li>Working knowledge of HTML5 (Canvas, WebWorkers, WebSockets), CSS3, SASS</li><li>Interest and ability to learn new technologies as required</li><li>Experience with one or more of the following technologies: Front-end development frameworks, Cloud services (Microsoft Azure), Message queue-based designs/implementations, Git code repositories, Reporting services (Power BI, Kibana, SSRS)</li><li>Knowledge of server-side configuration and deployment (IIS, TeamCity, Octopus, Azure DevOps)</li><li>Experience in a business to business consulting role<br><br></li></ul><strong>Logistics:<br></strong><ul><li>Start Date: ASAP</li><li>Hours/Week: Full-time</li><li>Team Structure: Small, growing team; work is fast paced and high volume</li><li>Interview process: 3 video interviews</li><li>Background Check needed? Yes, including felony/misdemeanor background checks (run by the client company) </li><li>Salary Range: $135-$145k base salary with a 15% bonus potential based on performance<br><br></li></ul>Job #49046<br><br>

description: Join our dynamic and inclusive team in Legal Services and take your career to new heights! We're a leading organization that fosters a collaborative culture, values professional development, and treats every team member with the utmost respect. At our company, recognized as an industry leader in workplace excellence, you'll have the chance to make a difference through your work. We invite you to bring your motivation, teamwork skills, and integrity, and we'll provide you with the opportunities and support you deserve.<br><br>As a Legal Specialist at our company, you'll play a vital role as a core member of our legal support team. You'll be responsible for handling benefits matters related to marital litigation and the division of retirement benefits under court orders, including Qualified Domestic Relations Orders (QDROs), custody orders, and subpoenas. Your day-to-day tasks will involve regular communication, both verbal and written, with retirement plan participants and external parties. Additionally, you'll provide valuable assistance to our attorneys, conducting research on benefit plan requirements and participant records, and offering general administrative support.<br><br>In this role, attention to detail, strong organizational skills, and the ability to prioritize effectively are essential. You'll have the opportunity to interact with various stakeholders, both internal and external, and your clear and effective communication will be key to your success.<br><br>Specifically, as a Legal Specialist, you'll have the chance to:<br><br>Review marital litigation and QDRO matters, preparing correspondence related to these cases.<br><br>Process the division of benefits according to QDROs and court orders, ensuring accurate documentation.<br><br>Maintain regular communication with participants, alternate payees, attorneys, and other external parties.<br><br>Provide financial and benefit plan information to internal staff, resolving issues and ensuring data accuracy.<br><br>Assist the Senior Legal Analyst in workflow management, including mail processing, document review, and record-keeping.<br><br>Provide general administrative support to the Legal Services department and contribute to various projects as needed.<br><br><strong><u>Here Are Some Of The Benefits You Can Expect<br><br></u></strong>At our company, we believe in supporting our employees' well-being and professional growth.<br><br>Comprehensive medical, dental, vision, and well-being benefits from our HealthFlex Exchange, available from day one.<br><br>Generous employer contribution of 8% to your retirement plan, with an additional match of up to 2% from day one.<br><br>Enjoy a healthy work-life balance with 22 days of paid time off plus 12 paid holidays.<br><br>Experience the flexibility of a hybrid work environment, allowing you to be effective whether working from the office or a remote location.<br><br><strong><u>Minimum Requirements/Qualifications<br><br></u></strong>Bachelor's degree or equivalent work experience.<br><br>3-5 years of prior experience in an office environment, preferably in an administrative, support, or customer service role.<br><br>Advanced oral and written communication skills.<br><br>Proficiency in MS Office applications.<br><br><strong><u>Preferred Requirements/Qualifications<br><br></u></strong>Previous experience in an administrative, legal, or employee benefits-related role.<br><br>Familiarity with benefits administration or pension record keeping.<br><br>Knowledge of pension and retirement benefits.<br><br>Wespath Benefits and Investments is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer, committed to creating an inclusive and diverse workplace.<br><br>Be the first to know about exciting opportunities like this. Subscribe to our job alerts for similar roles!<br><br>Employment Type: Full-Time<br><br>Salary: $ 13.00 30.00 Per Hour

title: Data Scientist
description: We are looking for a highly motivated, hands-on individual who can participate in the design, development and delivery work on our new InsuranceNow platform. This is a high visibility, high impact role where you will bring your experience with InsuranceNow to help us drive the successful delivery of this platform. At Preferred Risk we are building the next generation of our insurance platform leveraging Guidewire InsuranceNow and are looking to build strong technical skills in the application development and support of this new platform.<br><br>The Software Developer will participate in the design, development, and delivery of our insurance product portfolio on the InsuranceNow platform. We are searching for people who will bring their experience with InsuranceNow to help us drive the successful delivery of this high visibility, high impact project.<br><br><strong><u>Essential Duties &amp; Responsibilities<br></u></strong><ul><li>Product scoping, discovery, hands-on technical input and helping translate user features into system design</li><li>Work in an agile team, pair programming and support deliverables in production</li><li>Development of the all the required functions/features on the InsuranceNow platform</li><li>Driving the data migration from legacy systems to the new platform through data cleansing, data preparation and test bed creation</li><li>Receive and provide feedback in code reviews</li><li>Interface with and help evolve REST APIs</li><li>Do test-driven FrontEnd development to ensure high confidence in any code you develop</li><li>Work with the User Experience team to achieve a great user experience</li><li>Collaborate within the Scrum Team to understand the requirements and possible implementation options</li><li>Help develop Continuous Integration (CI) and Continuous Deployment (CD)</li><li>Own, troubleshoot &amp; resolve code defects</li><li>Exert technical influence to improve the reliability of our products and systems</li><li>Ability to rapidly absorb new technologies and have the desire to work in a fast-paced environment</li><li>Bring your experience to coach and mentor other engineers technically. Ability to drive results.<br></li></ul><strong><u>Qualifications<br></u></strong><ul><li>Knowledge of P&amp;C Insurance </li><li>InsuranceNow development experience </li><li>Strong software development skills in JavaScript (ES 6)</li><li>Strong technical communication skills</li><li>Understand REST API for data interchange</li><li>Have Agile, systematic problem-solving approach, coupled with strong interpersonal skills and a sense of ownership and drive</li><li>Strong individual contributor with strong experience delivering high-quality solutions</li><li>BA/BS in Computer Science or equivalent industry technical skills</li><li>Experience in designing, analyzing and solving problems for large-scale distributed systems</li><li>2+ years of work experience in a SaaS production environment for large-scale enterprise</li><li>Clean code practices</li><li>Interest in software / architectural design principles</li><li>Passionate about quality, mentoring junior candidates and in general a great team player</li><li>Experience working in an agile environment<br></li></ul><strong><em>Job Posted by ApplicantPro</em></strong>

title: Business Analyst
description: Are you a creative and passionate Front-End Developer looking to make a difference? Join our team and contribute to building the next generation of award-winning, online banking web applications that are used by millions of customers worldwide. We are seeking an innovative individual who is enthusiastic about front-end technology, user experience, and has extensive experience in developing dynamic, responsive web applications. If you have a strong background in HTML5, CSS3, and JavaScript, along with experience in modern JavaScript frameworks like React, Angular, Vue, or Ember, we want to hear from you!<br><br><strong><u>Responsibilities<br><br></u></strong>As a Senior Front-End Developer, you will play a crucial role in creating innovative digital banking products that deliver outstanding customer experiences.<br><br>Collaborate with cross-functional teams, including business, UX design, and back-end API teams, to develop world-class customer experiences using Agile development methodologies.<br><br>Mentor junior developers and collaborate with fellow developers to design and implement effective solutions.<br><br>Ensure secure coding standards through peer code reviews and automated testing.<br><br>Guide development teams in reviewing business requirements, design documents, test plans/test cases, and performance testing plans.<br><br>Effectively communicate technical solutions and recommendations to senior management.<br><br><strong><u>Required Qualifications<br><br></u></strong>Bachelor's degree in computer science or equivalent combination of experience and education (consideration will be given to strong candidates without a degree, but years of experience are crucial).<br><br>Expertise in browser-based technology, user interface development, responsive web design, and writing cross-browser, cross-device compliant code.<br><br>Strong proficiency in HTML5, web template engines (Markdown, Handlebars, JSX, Jade), CSS3, and CSS preprocessors (SASS, LESS, etc.).<br><br>Extensive experience in JavaScript/ES6/TypeScript and MVC JavaScript frameworks (React, Vue, Angular, Ember).<br><br>Strong experience in consuming REST APIs using asynchronous methods.<br><br>Proficiency in version control (Git/Bitbucket) and branching strategies.<br><br>Familiarity with command-line utilities and build tools (Webpack, Grunt, Gulp).<br><br>Background in server-side JavaScript development.<br><br>Experience with defect analysis and resolution in an enterprise environment.<br><br>Excellent communication skills, both written and verbal, with the ability to communicate ideas and best practices effectively.<br><br>Ability to mentor and guide more junior developers.<br><br>Enthusiasm, commitment to quality, and a desire to be part of an innovative team.<br><br><strong><u>Nice-to-Have Skills<br><br></u></strong>Experience in writing high-quality, semantic, testable, and maintainable code.<br><br>Strong proficiency in creating highly performant, optimized websites.<br><br>Knowledge of 508 Compliance/Web Accessibility.<br><br>Familiarity with JavaScript testing frameworks (Mocha, Jasmine, Jest, etc.).<br><br>Experience with NodeJS.<br><br>Ability to work collaboratively within an Agile operating model.<br><br>Strong collaboration skills and the ability to provide constructive and respectful feedback.<br><br>Familiarity with standards and best practices in web development.<br><br>Join our team of dynamic professionals and contribute to cutting-edge projects in a fully remote work environment!<br><br>Employment Type: Full-Time<br><br>Salary: $ 67,000.00 183,000.00 Per Year

title: Platform Engineer
description: Littelfuse is one of America’s Best Mid-Sized Companies (Forbes) and has been named one of the Best Places to Work in Illinois (Best Companies Group) for 11 consecutive years. With its global headquarters in Chicago, Illinois, USA, Littelfuse is a leading, global manufacturer of electronic components serving more than 100,000 end customers across industrial, transportation, and electronics end markets. We have more than 17,000 employees with operations in 15 countries. From semiconductors to sensors… switches to fuses and more… we produce billions of electronic components that help our customers empower a sustainable, connected, and safer world. In 2021, Littelfuse had net sales of $2.1 billion.<p><br></p><strong>Test Engineer </strong>Provide hands-on experimental design and execution for electrical stress testing, environmental stress, accelerated profiles, mechanical stress, Test to Failure / Reliability testing models, FMEAs, Control Plans, etc.<p><br></p><strong>Responsibilities</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Define test plans, methodology and coverage to ensure product quality and reliability.</li><li>Will be responsible for timely completion of testing and reporting</li><li>Responsible for thorough and accurate reporting of test results internally and externally </li><li>Must maintain high level of data integrity regarding reporting of test results<br><br></li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Experience</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Knowledge of Statistical Techniques, Reliability testing, and Design of Experiments.</li><li>Experience in Automotive Electrical Component Design or Product Validation. </li><li>Knowledge of Automotive based DC electrical test equipment.</li><li>Ability to interpret electrical schematics. of principles of Mechanics of Materials and fatigue behaviors, thermomechanical and vibration problems.</li><li>Experience with Minitab </li><li>Experience in APQP Procedures</li><li>Knowledge of basic ISO16949 and VDA 6.3 Structures and Requirements</li><li>Basic Knowledge of solid works and engineering drawings.</li><li>Labview (or other automation software) knowledge preferred.<br><br></li></ul><p><br></p>Littelfuse strives to empower associate growth and development in a culture of ongoing collaboration and respect for diverse global perspectives and expertise. Our Core Values – Customer Focus, Respect, Agility, Collaboration – support us in our mission to improve the safety, reliability, and performance of our customers’ products and systems that use electrical energy.<p><br></p>We are an equal-opportunity employer that takes pride in giving every associate the means and courage to make a difference – everywhere, every day.
industry: Appliances, Electrical, and Electronics Manufacturing and Semiconductor Manufacturing

title: Software Developer (contract)
description: If you are a current Chamberlain Group employee, please click here to apply through your Workday account.<p><br></p>This role is responsible for applying basic knowledge to the design and development of embedded applications on hardware platforms. The focus in this role includes creation of technical specifications, application firmware design and development, and support for manufacturing and regulatory approval. Knowledge of basic software development practices and principles is required. An Engineer 2, Firmware must support their peers in day-to-day development activities and be able to troubleshoot platform defects of limited complexity. This role will be responsible for both individual and team based software development activities<p><br></p>Job Responsibilities:<p><br></p><ul><li>Design, develop, and implement application level firmware solutions to meet business needs</li><li>Work with stakeholders to understand functional requirements of systems to accurately develop designs, implementations and test cases</li><li>Design and develop application firmware using best practices that adhere to product specifications using an Agile development process</li><li>Create and maintain technical specifications as related to product development</li><li>Work with senior engineers to implement scalable designs and modular functional blocks that meet product requirements</li><li>Use design analysis techniques such as FMEA or rate monotonic analysis to validate software designs prior to implementation. Ability to accurately document an intended design is critical</li><li>Create unit test cases that accurately test interface functionality and responses to varied inputs both in and out of scope</li><li>Analyze, troubleshoot, and resolve firmware defects as found during bench, lab, and production QA testing</li><li>Apply software quality tools such as Lint, Understand, and other static and dynamic analysis tools to verify software releases meet quality and coding standards</li><li>Support regulatory engineering for FCC and other outside agency approval of end products</li><li>Support manufacturing on site during as needed for engineering and production builds</li><li>Manage own work to deliver according to project schedules; be accountable for delivery</li><li>Actively contribute to the adoption of software architecture, best practices, and technologies</li><li>Responsible for complying with the security requirements set forth by the Information Security team and the established ISO 27001 Security Roles, Responsibilities, and Authorities Document found in the ISMS Document Library</li><li>Comply with health and safety guidelines and rules; managers should also ensure compliance across their teams</li><li>Protect Chamberlain Group’s reputation by keeping information confidential</li><li>Maintain professional and technical knowledge by attending educational workshops, reading professional publications, establishing personal networks, and participating in professional societies</li><li>Contribute to the team effort by accomplishing related results and participating on projects as needed</li></ul><p><br></p>Job Requirements:<p><br></p><ul><li>Bachelor’s degree in computer engineering, computer science, electrical engineering, related technical field or equivalent practical experience</li><li>An advanced degree in directly applicable area of study may substitute for up to two (2) years of experience</li><li>1+ years of job-related experience as defined in the Essential Duties and Responsibilities</li><li>Able to travel up to 10% - domestically and internationally</li></ul><p><br></p>Preferred Job Requirements:<p><br></p><ul><li>Ability to work within cross functional teams to create electro-mechanical products; strong analytical skills; effective communication skills; Oriented programming experience; TCP, UPD, HTTP, WebSockets, MQTT, or other connected protocols</li><li>Agile/Scrum experience</li></ul><p><br></p>We're an organization who values its human capital and provides support to assist its employees succeed.<p><br></p>Chamberlain Group is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer. You will be considered for this position based upon your experience and education, without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, sexual orientation, ancestry; marital, disabled or veteran status. We are committed to creating and maintaining a workforce environment that is free from any form of discriminations or harassment.<p><br></p>Persons with disabilities who anticipate needing accommodations for any part of the application process may contact, in confidence Recruiting@Chamberlain.com.<p><br></p>NOTE: Staffing agencies, headhunters, recruiters, and/or placement agencies, please do not contact our hiring managers via email or phone or other methods.

title: Dynamics NAV Developer - Chicago, IL - $125k - Remote
description: <strong>Duration</strong>: 5+ months<p><br></p><strong><u>Job Description</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Data Governance &amp; Data catalog SME/ Advisory / E2 (part time)</li><li>Proven experience defining, designing and implementing Enterprise Data governance and Data management policies with organizations </li><li>Work closely with the CDO office and other senior executives to strategize and define the data governance operating model, policy and standards hierarchy</li><li>Proven experience implementing Data Governance organization and resource models (Centralized, Federated, Hybrid etc.)</li><li>Design and operationalize a centralized Metrics program to effectively measure, monitor and report on organization wide Data governance conformance </li><li>Well versed with emerging and leading Data governance trends AI/ML Data governance, Cloud data governance, Data governance for Data Mesh &amp; Data Fabric, Data democratization, Data Marketplace enablement etc.</li><li>Drive adoption of the data governance program across the business domains across the administrative and downstream systems </li><li>Responsible to deliver fit for purpose quality data for data democratization, working in conjunction with the Business area leaders.</li></ul><p><br></p>The Capgemini Freelancer Gateway is enabled by a cutting-edge software platform that leads the contingent labor world for technology innovation. The software platform leverages Machine Learning and Artificial Intelligence to make sure the right people end up in the right job.<p><br></p>A global leader in consulting, technology services and digital transformation, Capgemini is at the forefront of innovation to address the entire breadth of clients’ opportunities in the evolving world of cloud, digital and platforms. Building on its strong 50 year heritage and deep industry-specific expertise, Capgemini enables organizations to realize their business ambitions through an array of services from strategy to operations. Capgemini is driven by the conviction that the business value of technology comes from and through people. It is a multicultural company of over 200,000 team members in more than 40 countries. The Group reported 2018 global revenues of EUR 13.2 billion.<p><br></p>

title: Legal Specialist - Remote | WFH
description: Hendrickson is searching for a Project Engineer to join their Spring Engineering team at the Tech Center in Woodridge, IL.<p><br></p>This engineer will be responsible for managing all technical aspects of various leaf spring projects. Responsibilities include but are not limited to:<p><br></p><ul><li> Manage all technical aspects of multiple and/or major projects utilizing the Product Planning and Development Procedure.</li><li> Designs, validates, provides test reports and sign-off documents, and ensures production readiness.</li><li> Coordinates with CAD, FEA and laboratory personnel and interfaces with other departments in support of the above.</li><li> Coordinates the technical design and test aspects on projects with suppliers and customers.</li><li> Provides continuous improvement through employee development, process improvement and elimination of waste.</li><li> Helps to assure safety in the lab and office.</li><li> Other duties as assigned.</li></ul><p><br></p>The successful candidate will possess:<p><br></p><ul><li> Bachelor of Science degree in technical discipline required. BSME/BSAgE/BS preferred.</li><li> 4+ years’ experience in vehicle structural design (preferable heavy or medium duty truck) with exposure to dynamic structural analysis, finite element analysis, fatigue analysis, and product design.</li><li> Demonstrated product innovation.</li><li> Electrical or brake experience a plus.</li><li> Project management experience preferred</li></ul><p><br></p>Physical requirements in this role require:<p><br></p><ul><li> Frequent sitting and working at computer for extended periods of time.</li><li> Occasional standing and walking on concrete.</li><li> Occasional climbing stairs and fixed/vertical ladders.</li><li> Ability to lift and carry up to 60lbs.</li><li> Ability to push/pull carts (minimal 25lbs) and parts (minimal 60lbs).</li><li> Ability to drive as required.</li><li> Ability to travel as required.</li><li> Demonstrated ability to meet product development deadlines.</li></ul><p><br></p>Hendrickson is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or status as a protected veteran.<p><br></p>Additional Information<p><br></p><ul><li>Requisition ID: 230000O1</li></ul>
industry: Motor Vehicle Manufacturing, Industrial Machinery Manufacturing, and Truck Transportation

title: Software Developer – Guidewire InsuranceNow
description: Harris Associates is committed to bringing together individuals whose diverse backgrounds, opinions and perspectives maximize our expertise in finding value and delivering an excellent client experience.<br><br><strong>The Position<br><br></strong>This role is within the Operations Technology team. Our mission is to empower our investment professionals to achieve greater success by leveraging Technology &amp; Data to enhance all facets of our decision-making.<br><br>We seek creative software engineers with strong analytical &amp; collaborative skills to join our team of highly qualified technology professionals to work towards our shared vision of unlocking the alpha in technology. Intellectual curiosity with a keen interest in investing &amp; asset management are essential for a rewarding career and long-term success at the firm.<br><br><strong>Responsibilities<br></strong><ul><li>Work with the team to design, develop &amp; support software, and vendor integrations on our systems.</li><li>Collaborate with the team on software development lifecycle to develop, test &amp; deploy applications</li><li>Develop business expertise in supported areas, related technology, data domains and vendor platforms.</li><li>Partner with stakeholders on efforts to modernize and transform our platforms to leverage cloud-native solutions to democratize technology &amp; data across the enterprise.</li><li>As part of support escalations, triage &amp; solve production incidents and participate in support activities for critical issues during business hours and when necessary, weeknights or weekends.<br><br></li></ul><strong>Qualifications<br><br></strong><u>Required<br></u><ul><li>At least 5 years’ work experience in the asset management industry with specific knowledge of Investment Accounting and Order Management</li><li>Expertise with the .NET framework, C#, SQL Server, database, and application design &amp; development</li><li>Experience building applications and integrations using Azure platforms &amp; services</li><li>Experience with API design, messaging / event-driven architecture &amp; modern test frameworks</li><li>Strong collaborative, communication, and problem-solving skills</li><li>4-year degree in a STEM discipline or equivalent professional experience<br><br></li></ul><strong>Preferred<br></strong><ul><li>Experience with Eagle and Charles River Investment Systems</li><li>Expertise in development and orchestration of Azure data pipelines</li><li>Familiarity with trade life cycle, security data management, and other middle office processes<br><br></li></ul><strong>Equal Employment Opportunity Policy Statement<br><br></strong>Harris Associates L.P. pursues a policy of equal opportunity in all areas of employment including recruitment, hiring, training, compensation, benefits, advancement, and treatment on the job. This means that Harris does not discriminate against employees, or qualified applicants, based on an individual's race, color, religion, creed, sex, age, national origin, physical disability, sexual orientation, trans-gender status, transsexual status, status as a veteran or disabled veteran, genetic information or for any other reason prohibited by law. Harris reserves the right to review publicly available information about applicants (i.e., via social networking sites), to the extent permissible under applicable law.<br><br><strong>Reasonable Accommodation Notice<br><br></strong>We provide reasonable accommodation for individuals with disabilities and disabled veterans in job application procedures. If you have any difficulty using our online system and you need an accommodation due to a disability, you may use the alternative email address below to contact us about your interest in employment at HR@harrisassoc.com or you can call us at 312-646-3600.<br><br><strong>Privacy Statement<br><br></strong>The information you send to us is used for employment purposes only. What you send is kept confidential—we will not give your personal information to outside parties without your consent.

title: Software Developer (contract)
description: <strong><u>Responsibilities</u></strong><p><br></p>"Understand requirement and translate that to product features.<p><br></p>"Participate in Scrum meetings and express the work done and the plan clearly. Participate in scrum ceremonies and clearly communicate.<p><br></p>"Develop applications using Front end, middleware, and database related technologies.<p><br></p>"Coding standard should be followed, and the code should be highly performant.<p><br></p>"Should be able to write unit test cases using any of the frameworks and should be completely automated.<p><br></p>"Should have strong exposure in REST API design and principles and adhere to RAML/Swagger or Open API specification<p><br></p>"Should be able to develop reusable components using proper design patterns as listed by lead/architect so that it is extensible.<p><br></p>"Should be able to use design patterns and implement the right solution.<p><br></p>"Should be able to do code review and implement automation wherever required to ease development process.<p><br></p><strong><u>Essential Skills</u></strong><p><br></p>"Total IT Experience 7 to 12 years<p><br></p>"3+ years of in-depth knowledge in core Java, 17 , spring and Hibernate<p><br></p>"3+ years of experience in spring boot 3.0<p><br></p>"2+ years of experience in Stream API, Reactive Programming(WebFlux, WebClient),<p><br></p>"2+ years of experience in development of Microservices, Docker, Kubernetes and cloud deployment<p><br></p>"2+ years of experience in Spring Boot Micro Services,JPA, Hibernate, Junits, Mockito, Service Contract Understanding<p><br></p>"Good communication and unit testing knowledge.<p><br></p>"Good to have knowledge in one of the cloud platform Azure Cloud (Cosmos, Azure SQL server, AIS ), Micro Services Design Patterns, Deployment Patterns,Redis cache integration, commerce tools.<p><br></p>" Familiar with Continuous Integration methodologies and tools, including Jenkins

title: Xceptor Developer
description: Our client is currently seeking an Advanced Software Engineer in the Software Development department. The Advanced Software Engineer plays a critical role in the delivery of high quality products to the healthcare industry. A successful candidate will be able to demonstrate all essential functions to effectively design and construct modern software systems utilizing diverse technology sets while working within and across cross functional and geographically dispersed teams. This position is a remote opportunity.<br><br><strong><u>Primary Responsibilities<br><br></u></strong>Participate in the development of healthcare/business related applications.<br><br>Work with Product Owners and teams to drive features and specifications, architecture design, implementation, and other software development responsibilities.<br><br>Translate software requirements into a fully functional software solutions.<br><br>Participate in all phases of software development life cycles and the activities that occur within lifecycles.<br><br>Create, use, and promote the use of development frameworks, tools, methodologies, and procedures to reduce future coding efforts and increase functional consistency.<br><br>Knowledgeable of strong coding practices; implements logical database designs, logical data models and relational data definitions in support of corporate and customer information systems requirements.<br><br>Thorough understanding of Object-Oriented Programming Principles and design patterns.<br><br>Develop and maintain technical documentation.<br><br><strong><u>Required Skills<br><br></u></strong>Desire and able to quickly learn new skills.<br><br>Excellent analytical, programming, and troubleshooting skills.<br><br>Communicate effectively with all levels of the organization.<br><br>Able to thrive in a fast-paced, client-focused, changing environment.<br><br>Able to work independently and be self-directed.<br><br>2+ years developing/deploying software in Azure.<br><br>Experience with container technology framework (Docker/Kubernetes) Establish Cl/CD pipelines using Azure DevOps Experience with Source control using GIT Experience developing REST APls using the .NET framework, and consuming third-party REST API services.<br><br>Well-versed in Design Patterns and can point to specific instances where various design patterns were employed.<br><br>Experience with DevOps concepts including Continuous Integration, Continuous Deployment and release automation<br><br>Advanced experience in .NET application development using ASP.NET and C# or advanced experience in other languages such as java, ruby, go, etc.<br><br>Advanced experience in SQL queries Relational Database Experience (Oracle, SQL Server, MySQL, PostgreSQL)<br><br><strong><u>Preferred Skills<br><br></u></strong>Hands-on experience with microservices and infrastructure as code<br><br>Authentication and authorization using Active Directory (on-prem and Azure) Experience in a LINUX environment<br><br>Application Development via Java, Python, or Go NoSQL skills and experience<br><br>Experience in Agile or Lean projects<br><br>Experience or training in artificial intelligence techniques<br><br>Experience in Health Care Industry<br><br><strong><u>Required Experience<br><br></u></strong>Bachelor’s degree, Computer Science, or related field highly preferred<br><br>3+ years of Professional Software Development experience with good knowledge of Software Development Methodologies and processes.<br><br>If you think this position is a good fit for you, please reach out to me - feel free e-mail me, or apply to this posting!<br><br>Employment Type: Full-Time<br><br>Salary: $ 75,000.00 191,000.00 Per Year

title: UI/Front End Developer - Remote | WFH
description: Actalent Services is seeking a Robotics Programmer to join our team. The Robotics Programming Engineer Position will be responsible for a combination of programming robots, designing electrical drawings, and installation &amp; service of completed robot cells at customer locations. The primary responsibility will be managing multiple robot programming projects at once. Advanced Internal Training is available. There will be opportunities to further develop hands on skills such as well as welding, manual and CNC machining, design, R&amp;D, or other interest that the candidate has.<p><br></p><strong><u>Description</u></strong><p><br></p>The Automation Engineer Position will be a combination of designing, building, programming, installation, training, and service. The primary will be programing and installation of custom robotics projects throughout the year. Currently we use and integrate ABB, Fanuc, Kuka, and Yaskawa robots. Internal Training is available. There will be opportunities to further develop robotic skills as well as welding, machining, design, R&amp;D, or other interests that the employee has.<p><br></p><strong><u>Job Duties</u></strong><p><br></p>Progamming Fanuc, Kuka, and ABB Single and Multi Axis Robots<p><br></p>Wiring<p><br></p>Fabricating<p><br></p>Assembly<p><br></p><strong><u>Programming</u></strong><p><br></p>Safety Systems<p><br></p>Robots (Fanuc, ABB, Kuka)<p><br></p>Press brake machinery<p><br></p><strong><u>Installation</u></strong><p><br></p>Engineer follows a single project<p><br></p>Regional/national travel to customer site<p><br></p>Onsite customer training<p><br></p>Follow up service<p><br></p><strong><u>Job Skills</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>High and Low voltage knowledge</li><li>Robot Programming (ABB, Fanuc, Kuka, or Yaskawa)</li><li>Mechanical aptitude</li><li>Machining</li><li>Welding</li><li>SolidWorks</li><li>Banner Safety Logic</li><li>Banner Scanner Software</li><li>E-Cockpit / Codesys</li><li>Microsoft Office</li></ul><p><br></p>Diversity, Equity &amp; Inclusion<p><br></p><strong><u>DE&amp;I Are Embedded Into Our Culture Through</u></strong><p><br></p>At Actalent, diversity and inclusion are a bridge towards the equity and success of our people.<p><br></p><ul><li>Hiring diverse talent</li><li>Maintaining an inclusive environment through persistent self-reflection</li><li>Building a culture of care, engagement, and recognition with clear outcomes</li><li>Ensuring growth opportunities for our people</li></ul><p><br></p>Actalent is an equal opportunity employer.<p><br></p><strong><u>About Actalent</u></strong><p><br></p>Actalent connects passion with purpose. We help visionary companies advance their engineering and science initiatives through access to specialized experts that drive scale, innovation, and speed to market. With a network of almost 30,000 engineering and sciences consultants and more than 4,500 clients across the U.S., Canada, Asia, and Europe, Actalent serves many of the Fortune 500. An operating company of Allegis Group, the global leader in talent solutions, Actalent launched as a new specialized engineering and sciences services and workforce solutions brand in 2021.

title: Firmware Engineer II
description: <strong><u>Description</u></strong><p><br></p>Actalent Services is seeking a Robotics Programmer to join our team. The Robotics Programming Engineer Position will be responsible for a combination of programming robots, designing electrical drawings, and installation &amp; service of completed robot cells at customer locations. The primary responsibility will be managing multiple robot programming projects at once. Advanced Internal Training is available. There will be opportunities to further develop hands on skills such as well as welding, manual and CNC machining, design, R&amp;D, or other interest that the candidate has.<p><br></p><strong><u>Description</u></strong><p><br></p>The Automation Engineer Position will be a combination of designing, building, programming, installation, training, and service. The primary will be programing and installation of custom robotics projects throughout the year. Currently we use and integrate ABB, Fanuc, Kuka, and Yaskawa robots. Internal Training is available. There will be opportunities to further develop robotic skills as well as welding, machining, design, R&amp;D, or other interests that the employee has.<p><br></p><strong><u>Job Duties</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Programming Fanuc, Kuka, and ABB Single and Multi Axis Robots</li><li>Wiring</li><li>Fabricating</li><li>Assembly</li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>Programming</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Safety Systems</li><li>Robots (Fanuc, ABB, Kuka) </li><li>Press brake machinery</li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>Installation</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Engineer follows a single project</li><li>Regional/national travel to customer site</li><li>Onsite customer training</li><li>Follow up service</li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>Skills</u></strong><p><br></p>Electrical Engineering, AutoCAD, Robot Programming, PLC Programming, Schematic Design, SolidWorks, Allen-Bradley, Fanuc Programming, Fanuc Control, ABB Controls, Kuka Programming, Troubleshooting, Electrical, Fanuc Robots, Fanuc, ABB, Yaskawa, Vision Robotics, Cognex Vison, HMI, Schematic, Safety Systems, Vison Systems, Rockwell, RSLogix, AutoCAD Electrical, SolidWorks Electrical<p><br></p><strong><u>Additional Skills &amp; title: Xceptor Developer
description: <ul><li>Company with sports and technology at its core - with mobile and web apps|Fullstack opportunity using C#, ASP.NET, React with small team of 6 developers<br><br><br></li></ul><strong>About Our Client<br><br></strong>Our client was founded over 20 years ago in the Spectator Sports industry, gearing their platform to serve a wide array of youth sports organizations across the US. They're currently the leading provider of technology solutions for all of the youth sports teams in the US, operating web and mobile platforms with over 1M onboarded users. Their main challenge now is merging their technology to integrate with a company they acquired, while continuing to maintain operation of their platforms with minimal downtime. These are high impact projects that enrich the experiences of youth athletes, and simplify<br><br><strong>Job Description<br><br></strong>The Selected Software Developer will:<br><ul><li>Use React Native for all mobile development projects.</li><li>Remain up to date with development breakthroughs and follows best practices.</li><li>Use, rework, and adapt existing web applications for mobile apps.</li><li>Create and test software prototypes when needed.</li><li>Develop client displays and user interfaces in a Fullstack capacity.</li><li>Perform complete testing of web applications-unit and end-to-end automated testing, engaging users as necessary.</li><li>Develop SQL database-driven web interfaces.</li><li>Utilize front-end web technologies to create interactive user experiences with rich functionality.</li><li>Take charge of story development without needing micromanagement.<br><br></li></ul><em>MPI does not discriminate on the basis of race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, national origin, age, disability, veteran status, marital status, or based on an individual's status in any group or class protected by applicable federal, state or local law. MPI encourages applications from minorities, women, the disabled, protected veterans and all other qualified applicants.<br><br></em><strong>The Successful Applicant<br><br></strong>The Successful Software Developer has:<br><ul><li>4+ years of Fullstack experience.</li><li>Bachelor's Degree in Computer Science or related field.</li><li>Boot camp certificate (with at least 2 additional years of experience).</li><li>Strong proficiency with React Native.</li><li>Exposure or experience working in C#/.NET is highly preferred but not required.</li><li>Experience using SQL databases - either relational and/or non-relational experience.</li><li>Experience working with REST APIs.</li><li>Strong attention to detail, always looking to create robust solutions that minimize excess redundancies.</li><li>Excellent troubleshooting and communication skills.</li><li>Clear documentation.</li><li>A desire to have an impact on the world with the software being developed.</li></ul><strong>What's on Offer<br><br></strong>What's on Offer for the Selected Software Developer?<br><ul><li>Base salary very open for the right candidate, in the range of 140k-180k depending on experience.</li><li>Affordable comprehensive healthcare plans, with more than 80% of out of pocket costs covered.</li><li>401k with 4% company match, no waiting period for matched contributions.</li><li>Unlimited Paid Time Off program, with no expectations, thresholds, or strings attached.</li><li>Person first model, i.e. you're a person before you're a developer allowing flexibility for when life just happens.</li><li>Hybrid in the office in Northbrook up to twice a week, can make exceptions as needed.</li><li>Dynamic culture, tech minded individuals looking to make a difference with their coding.</li><li>Mentorship, management, and leadership opportunities within.</li><li>Onboarding program to make the transition period run smoothly.</li><li>Optional outings to visit Chicago Sports teams, games, press events, networking events.<br></li></ul><strong>Contact: Emily Bodett<br><br></strong><strong>Quote job ref: JN-072023-6118167</strong>
industry: IT Services and IT Consulting, Software Development, and Computer and Network Security

title: Software Engineer - Investment Ops Technology
description: Dice is the leading career destination for tech experts at every stage of their careers. Our client, Motion Recruitment, is seeking the following. Apply via Dice today!<p><br></p>This client has created an innovative search and booking engine that helps customers find the best ways to use their travel points and miles. Not only have they been ranked 5/5 stars as the best booking service of 2021, but they also have also been advertised by Forbes, The New York Times, ABC and more!<p><br></p>It searches 30+ loyalty and 100+ airline programs to find the best value possible.<p><br></p>They find the best flights for your points - including seats the airlines don't advertise. Then they show your options side-by-side, so you know you're getting the best deal.<p><br></p>They emphasize diversity and are crafting an inclusive, collaborative, and exciting culture for their team members to grow with.<p><br></p>They have multiple openings including Mid and Senior level roles. As a Full Stack Java Engineer, you will build a consumer website by developing sophisticated algorithms and highly available systems to offer best-in-class services to their customers. You will help build the systems and algorithms that power their services, scale those systems for growth, and continuously improve their engineering practice! You will be leveraging Java, Spring Boot, React, and CI/CD pipelines while deploying into AWS using Docker.<p><br></p><strong>Required Skills &amp; Experience</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Degree in Computer Science or something complementary </li><li>2-5 years of experience in Software Development </li><li>Strong experience with AWS </li><li>Docker/Kubernetes </li><li>React </li><li>CICD using Jenkins </li><li>Testing experience using either Cucumber or Selenium preferably </li></ul> <strong>The Offer</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Health Insurance Benefits </li><li>Dental Benefits </li><li>Vision Benefits </li><li>PTO Minimum of 15 Days </li><li>Team Outings and Trips </li></ul> FullStack Engineer/SaaS/Remote/Amazing Work Culture<p><br></p>
